dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of identical safe deposit boxes... A black valise crammed with money... A FERRET-NOSED man, JULIO by name, the cash-filled valise into a box, flips the lid shut... box is returned to its slot... A key locks the box door..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT “BOBBY” TRENCH, aka “Bobby T,” aka “Bobby B,” aka “Bobby Beans,” (Late 30s, taciturn) studies a BULLET HOLE a Victorian marble column. A scar of long ago violence. Behind Bobby, Ferret Nose emerges from the vault. Bobby hides his face as Ferret Nose crosses behind him and exit MS. YOUNG (early 20s and perky) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MS. YOUNG
dialogues.text: Admiring our bullet hole? Billy the Kid put that there during a robbery in 1880.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How much did he get away with?

dialogues.speaker: MS. YOUNG
dialogues.text: The vault was locked for the day. Sheriff did shoot two of Billy’s men on the front steps though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Young chatters, but Bobby isn’t listening. Bobby is staring at the wall of safe deposit boxes.

dialogues.speaker: MS. YOUNG
dialogues.text: Your box will be available any time from an hour after opening to 30 minutes before close. Also if you open a checking account, we'll give you 5% off the box along with free overdraft protection.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And here I was hoping for a free toaster.

dialogues.speaker: MS. YOUNG
dialogues.text: Why would a bank give out toasters? Bobby’s phone RINGS.  9/15/09 2guns 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK “STIG” STIGMAN (no aka’s, a manic ball of forward leaning energy) sits looking out at the sleepy main drag Tres Cruces. Specifically at the entrance of the Tres Cru S & L where Ferret Nose climbs into a car with two other rough characters and drives off. A WAITRESS idles at Stig’s table.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m ordering you the french toast.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No, Ma, nothing important.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Our very patient waitress, Maggie -- at least it says Maggie on her name tag -- has poured me four cups of coffee. If I don’t order at this point, it’s just rude.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I can come back.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: I’m making an executive decision. Pancakes. OUT THE WINDOW - CAMERA finds Bobby emerging from the ban striding toward the diner.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No, no pancakes. I hate pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: What are you a communist? (to the Waitress) I‘1l have the hash and my friend’1l have the pancakes with a fried egg.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: If she brings me eggs and pancakes, I will kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: You need to eat breakfast. It’s the most important meal of the day. DOOR CHIMES jingle as Bobby marches in.  9/15/09 2guns 3.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ignore everything he’s said. If you'll just bring me an 0O.J., that’d be great.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Bring him coffee and toast too. As the waitress retreats, Stig gives her a big wink.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why do you have to do that?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wink at the waitress. You hang her up for five minutes then give her a creepy wink like you’re gonna ask her to take a ride in your Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Hey, waitresses like me.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nobody likes you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m a likable guy. I’m a good tipper. So. The bank?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The bank. As Bobby talks we flash to IMAGES of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby surveys the bank as Ms. Young leads him back to the vault. The bank is old-fashioned in its architecture but modern in its security features. In sync with the V.O. Bo notes the cameras, position of the guard, alarm buttons,

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (V.O. - CONT. FROM PREVIOUS)
dialogues.text: 4 tellers, 1 guard. Bulletproof glass, multiple security cameras. The manager’s office is between the tellers and the vault so we’1ll have to hope we catch him on the floor. Beyond that the safe deposit boxes are just sitting there.  9/15/09 2guns 4. INT. DINER —- CONTINUOUS FROM ABOVE

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So it’s doable? Bobby nods. Stig slaps his hands on the table with glee. DOOR CHIMES. Two SHERIFF’S DEPUTIES enter. Stig and Bobby go silent and tight. Greeting the staff by name, the deputies settle in at the counter and help themselves to the display of jelly donut The waitress returns with Bobby’s O.J. and coffee for Sti

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I'll be right back with your hash.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Wait. Maggie. Your jelly donuts, are they any good?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Best in three counties.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Put three in a to-go box. Two for me, one for him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Just two. Stig flashes three fingers to the waitress as she retreat A beat. Without preamble, Stig jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Gotta shake the weasel. As Stig vanishes into the back, one of the cops throws a glance Bobby’s way. Bobby gives the cop a flat look back. The waitress returns with Stig’s hash and the donuts.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I apologize for my friend. He was kicked in the head as a child.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Oh, he’s not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. He is.  9/15/09 2guns 5. Stig returns. Without sitting, he digs out a donut.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Mmm, these are good. We should go.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Your food just got here. Stig flicks his eyes at the cops.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You ever hear the saying “never rob a bank across from a diner with the best donuts in three counties?” Bobby stands and tosses cash on the table. Behind the counter SMOKE begins to curl out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s all you’re gonna leave for a tip?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You are a complete lunatic, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You gotta leave at least 30%. The woman’s about to be out of a job. The tendrils swell becoming flames as the kitchen is engu in a roaring grease fire.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (tossing down another $10) This, this is why nobody likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig saunter out the door and back to their car Behind them smoke billows. Chaos. Shouts. Alarms. Patrons and wait-staff flee. A FIREBALL blows out the windows. FREEZE FRAME: Bobby & Stig in F.G.; the blazing diner in MAIN TITLE CARD: “2 GUNS”  9/15/09 2guns 6.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERTITLE
dialogues.text: A private kingdom in the Sonora desert. Ancient stone wal Adobe buildings. Vaqueros on horseback work EXPANSIVE LIVESTOCK PENS. FIND Bobby and Stig speeding along. Past BARNS that house not just cattle but processing areas for cocaine and hero Past a DIRT AIRSTRIP where bales of marijuanas are being loaded onto a piper cub. Up to the MAIN HOUSE where a row barbecue is underway. Half a cow on a spit. Narco corrido on the stereo. No bling, no bimbos in mini skirts. Just hard men eating, drinking and slinging dominos. Bobby and Stig are greeted by RUDY (knife-scarred and wil Rudy shakes hands with Bobby. Stig, he ignores.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Papi’s down in the stables.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Go get something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig, you and I are here to do business. Diplomatically. If closing this deal involved shooting the wings off a fly while driving on two wheels through a ring of fire, I'd be the one getting something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can be diplomatic. A glare from Bobby. Stig goes. Reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, toting a duffle, is lead inside and down into a network of ancient tunnels that run beneath the ranch.  9/15/09 2guns 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy pauses at an antechamber and motions for Bobby to wa Nearby savage LAUGHTER erupts from a group of MEAN CHARAC who are taking turns peeking inside a bowling ball bag. MEAN #1 (OSCAR) holds the bag toward Bobby. Wanna see? Bobby shrugs. Oscar comes over. And with great flare snap the bag open under Bobby’s nose. We see nothing more than a wisp of hair, but the half-fli in Bobby's expression is enough to tell us there’s a huma head inside. Oscar and the others CACKLE. Returning, Rudy shoos the toughs and waves Bobby on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated on a wooden crate MANUEL “PAPI” GRECO (a man of ea and blood) plucks the feathers from a duck carcass. Loomi in the corner is Ferret-Nose Julio from the bank.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: “T-know-a-guy” Bobby. Quick: an ostrich, a tank of ether, and a ‘55 Thunderbird.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Will you take a ‘56?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: In El Paso by Wednesday?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I know a guy. Papi finds this game a chuckle. He squishes his fingers i the flesh of the duck and digs out three pellets of bucks

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not for nothing, but who’s the head in the bag?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: My cousin.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Little Toro?  9/15/09 2guns 8.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Julio caught him skimming. Not that I blame Little Toro. Everybody skims a little cream, it’s human nature. But just ‘cuz it’s human, don’t mean you let it go. Papi takes a hatchet - THWACK - chops off the duck’s head PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) That for me? Bobby pulls a shiny new CHAINSAW from his duffle.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The gas-powered MS 270. Throttle trigger interlock, bumper spikes, quickstop chain-brake. Setting aside the duck, Papi comes over to examine his ne toy. Bobby sets a protective hand on the saw.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s my present? Papi motions to Ferret-Nosed Julio who tosses Bobby a satchel. Inside are 200 blank passports and 400 blank soc security cards. Bobby examines them. His expression sours

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are garbage.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: They’re what I got.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If I take these, I’m telling you I don't know my business, and I know my business. A sudden air of menace hangs. Papi’s boys glower.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You too good for my product?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m saying anyone who’d take these is stupid, desperate, or looking to put you in jail. Which one you think I am? A beat. Papi looks to his boys. Then shrugs/smirks.  9/15/09 2guns 9.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I told you he wouldn’t take ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So, what, is that it? I pass your test?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: It’s not just you. After Little Toro we’re running everybody through the blender. If it soothes your ego, I’1ll give you 39,000 for the ‘56 Thunderbird. Assuming it’s mint. THWACK - Papi chops off the duck’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four ROUGHNECKS shoot at a line of chickens buried up to their necks in the dirt. Bets are traded. A bottle is passed. Stig sits nearby finishing a plate of barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: That’s not very sporting. What chance are you giving the chickens? The roughnecks trade scornful remarks in Spanish and retu to their game. Stig hurls a leg bone at them. They stop. They glare.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I’m gonna kill a defenseless animal, I’m gonna honor its sacrifice by grilling it up into some tasty barbecue. What I’m not gonna do, is torture it just to prove I’m a crappy shot who can’t hit anything further away than his own pecker.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BY THE STABLES -
dialogues.text: Rudy walks Bobby back out into the harsh Mexican sunlight They spot Stig jousting with the roughnecks.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Looks like your junkyard dog’s off the chain again. Bobby grumbles/sighs and marches over to Stig.  9/15/09 2guns 10.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: They're torturing those chickens. A roughneck curses at Stig in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say that in English, monkey boy.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig. Look at me. You see that bag on the buffet table? Bobby points over at the barbecue/party where the men wit the bowling ball bag have joined the others.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Between the ribs and the potato salad?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: There’s a human head inside.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Aw, sonofa... That is uncool; that is not cool. The roughnecks mutter Spanish curses. Stig lunges at them Bobby grabs Stig. Stig calms.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all right. I’m all right. Stig and Bobby turn to go. Behind them the roughnecks CHUCKLE. That tears it. In one seamless motion Stig whips around and shoots the heads off all five chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig walk back across the ranch to their car.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I hate Mexico. I hate the dust, I hate the desert, I hate the beer.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m sure it hates you back.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You don’t think Papi suspects?  9/15/09 2guns 11.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If Papi knew we were planning to rip him off, it’d be our heads in that bag by the potato salad.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Nah, our two heads’d never fit ina bag that small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colossal border jam up. Car and buses and smoke belch trucks await inspection. Lines of day laborers cross on foot, ready to work hard. If they can find work, that is. Bobby and Stig sit in their non-moving car in the non-mov line. Bobby looks into the station wagon beside them. 5 Mexican house painters with sun-creased faces look back.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Papi’s guy delivers a briefcase full of money to that bank every two weeks. At that rate he’s gotta have, what, two mil stashed there?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Math sounds right.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What happens if we get caught?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If we get caught, it’1l be your fault and I’11 kill you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Sure, whatever, but say we do? And say Papi Greco mangles my corpse, runs it through a sawmill, something like that, would you come after him?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You wouldn't kill him? Because if he did that to you I’d kill him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Then you’re an idiot.  9/15/09 2guns 12.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You know why I’d kill him, because you’re my people and there’s a code.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: First up: there is no code. You do what you have to do. The rest is just stuff that makes you stupid.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: And second? (a look from Bobby) Right. We're not “people.” Because you, you don’t have people. Bingo. Bobby and Stig roll up to the inspection booth.

dialogues.speaker: BORDER GUARD
dialogues.text: Purpose for you visit to Mexico?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Quail hunting.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: My aunt in Tuba City had a heart attack so we cut our trip short. The guard considers Bobby and Stig. Considers their documents. Then retreats inside the shack.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Tuba City?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s near Odessa.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nice place?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Hell hole but she is my favorite aunt. A sudden commotion. Boots. Guns. Swarming men in kevlar. Before Bobby and Stig can react their car is surrounded b armed border agents. M-1l6s leveled, fingers on triggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team of border agents tear apart Bobby and Stig’s car.  9/15/09 2guns 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UNIFORMED BORDER AGENT grills Stig. DEA AGENT DEB REES (driven, but not without a sense of humor) observes.

dialogues.speaker: UNIFORMED AGENT
dialogues.text: Tell Agent Rees about Papi Greco.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Papi. Greco.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: He some kind of Mexican Santa Claus?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I didn’t fall off the turnip truck, Mr. Stigman and my roots aren’t blonde so how ‘bout you stop playing the stupid card?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No ma‘am. It’s my intent to cooperate with whatever you need. As an American, I know you’re just doing your job and sometimes innocent folks like me get caught up in the system. It’s like with the airlines. They didn’t lose your bag on purpose, but everybody takes it so personal. I bet you two see a lot of frowning faces. Stig winks at Deb. Deb rolls her eyes and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A similar HARD-CASE BORDER AGENT grills Bobby. DEA SUPERVISING AGENT MARLON JESSUP (decent, dedicated) sits on this one.

dialogues.speaker: HARD-CASE
dialogues.text: Tell us about your trip.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Lawyer.  9/15/09 2guns 14.

dialogues.speaker: HARD-CASE
dialogues.text: What’s the big deal? You were just down in Sonora?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: HARD-CASE
dialogues.text: (re: Jessup) You think Agent Jessup and the DEA don’t know about you and Papi Greco? They know you were at his ranch.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Lawyer. Hard-Case bristles. Jessup puts a hand on his shoulder an nods for Hard-Case to step out. Hard-Case goes. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Five border agents are ripping apart your car as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: They’re not gonna find anything.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Where'd you hide the passports?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: There are no passports.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The deal was in place. A hand to hand buy from Papi Greco for 200 passports.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I turned them down. (off Jessup’s disbelief) They were third rate crap. Deb enters.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Your pal, Stig’s a piece of work.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He winked at you, didn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Bobby rejected the passports.  9/15/09 2guns 15.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Papi was testing me. If I’d taken the passports, I’d never have gotten off the ranch alive.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t insult me. I’ve got four years in on this. I have waded through sewage. I had a bag with a human head in it shoved under my nose, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: I know. I know all you’ve been through and I know how you’ve had to give your life over to playing the part of Bobby Beans.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I can get Papi Greco. TI have an angle. The only trick is I need you to let me rob the Tres Cruces Savings & Loan.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: You want to rob a bank?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. Stig wants to rob the bank. It was his idea, he approached me, no entrapment. What I want is for you to help me stop him, just not until he’s accessed the safe deposit boxes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: And just why does “Stig” want to break into the safe deposit boxes?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Because Papi Greco has two million dollars stashed there, and if we can access the money -- like if it was evidence in a failed robbery -- we can nail him for unreported tax evasion and possibly RICO.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What happens to Stig?  9/15/09 2guns 16.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He takes it hard on a class B felony, does 20 years like a good fish. Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: I’m not going to like the answer, but why not just get a warrant?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We can’t. I can’t prove how I know what I know. At least not in open court.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Because how you know it is in violation of the rules of evidence?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t ask / don’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: If it’ll get us our man...

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: It’s suborning felony robbery.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s only felony robbery if I get away with the money.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: There are rules to what we do, Agent Trench. They stink and they’re awkward, but they’re the rules we've agreed to play by. Bobby scoffs/burns.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You can’t fight an avalanche with a teaspoon.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Maybe we can’t. But we’re sure gonna dig like hell.  9/15/09 2guns 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig drive away in their reassembled car. Stig jiggles his seat.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I think my seat’s loose. You ever get flagged like that before?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s like they thought we’d be holding. Which we woulda been if those passports had been any good. (a look from Bobby) I’m just saying.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Then say it. Stig reaches into his belt, pulls out a knife.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Are you playing me? ‘Cuz if I hadn’t spent the last ten months at your side, I’d think you weren’t really I-Know-A-Guy Bobby the man who can get anyone anything. I'd think you were playing me. Tension hang for a beat. Then Bobby scoffs and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Put that pig-sticker away.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (laughs ) I had you. The corner of your eye, it twitched. Just a little bit. Damn. Let’s get some tacos or something.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You gonna wink at the waitress?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.  9/15/09 2guns 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sloshes whiskey around in a plastic cup. A figure stirs in bed beside him.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: That's five bucks you owe me for thinking about work.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You think Jessup knows about us?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What “us?” You don’t do “us” and I am in a relationship. Fetching a plastic wrapped cup from the bathroom, Deb pou herself a matching whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Right, your imaginary boyfriend, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: His name’s not Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why not? Harvey’s got a great ring to it.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You don’t get to be jealous, Bobby. Not anymore. Bobby stifles a twinge but only half-way succeeds. Deb considers Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: DEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want me to take a run at Jessup, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The bank will get us Papi Greco.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: And in the end that’s all that matters to you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s not like I got a bunch of hobbies. The job’s what I’ve got. It’s the elephant I carry.  9/15/09 2guns 19.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: (resigned/disappointed) All right, I’1l talk to him. But if he still says no... Bobby gives her a kiss on the head. Then swills the rest his cup and starts to dress.

dialogues.speaker: DEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you ever really love me?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Of course, I did.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Ask a silly question...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I meant to love you. The room’s paid up for another 3 hours.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You always take me to the classiest joints. INT. BOBBY’S TOWNHOUSE - NIGHT A bland unit in a bland development. Bobby enters. Silenc lonely and hollow, hangs. Tossing his keys and gun on the table, Bobby goes into the BEDROOM and -- WHAP - a PHONE BOOK smacks Bobby. Bobby thuds to the floo Papi Greco steps over Bobby. With Papi are Rudy and Ferre Nose Julio.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I miss old fashion phone books. Policeman's best friend, right? But then you’d know. Because you are an undercover agent of the DEA. Rudy and Julio hoist Bobby up. Papi slams the phone book into Bobby’s gut. Bobby groan/gasp/moans. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) If you feel it’s your duty to give me a couple denials, I’1l respect that. I’m not gonna believe you and Rudy’s just gonna kick you upside the head, but feel free.  9/15/09 2guns 20.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. No, you got me. I’m a cop. And you’re all under arrest. WHAP - phone book shot to the temple.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I should kill you. But killing a federal agent draws a whole rain of crap. So instead, I was thinking: what do you figure might happen if a hundred thousand unexplained dollars materialized in your checking account? Bobby sees where Papi’s going. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) The only thing DEA hates more than drug dealers is crooked agents. But then 4 years deep cover, you were bound to go bad.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who burned me?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: It was Saint Peter and Virgin Mary. You think I’m gonna tell you? I. Am not. An asshole. Papi stomps Bobby’s chest. Bobby gasps/yowls/moans.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Your mother’s a one legged whore.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You trying to get me to shoot you? Bobby. It’s too much fun watching you squirm. Besides, truth is she was a whore. Two legs though. Enjoy prison. I hear they do entertaining things to dirty cops. Papi tosses aside the phone book and exits. Delivering fi kicks to the gut, Rudy and Ferret-Nose Julio follow.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 7-11
dialogues.text: Bobby scuttles in. Inserts his card into the ATM. His balance flashes “$108,763.31” Bobby slams the machine. Th kid behind the counter glares.  9/15/09 2guns 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb works at her desk. Bobby hurries in.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I need you to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I haven’t had a chance to brace Jessup. ACROSS THE BULLPEN - Jessup calls out from his office.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Bobby. If you’ll come in my office for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: One sec. (pulling Deb’s arm) Come on, let’s go, we gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Now, Bobby. Please. A beat. No real option, Bobby reluctantly comes. INT. JESSUP’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Sit down. Bobby reads Jessup’s face. He notes the bank records layi on Jessup’s desk. Jessup knows.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Papi Greco planted the money in my account.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He knows I’m close to nailing him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter.  9/15/09 2guns 22. Beat. Bobby’s screwed.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This is... I ama lot of things but I am not on the take.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Then the truth will bear that out. Pending an investigation, you are as of now on unpaid administrative leave. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’m... You know I'd never...

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (a beat then) I’‘ll rob the Tres Cruces.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Bobby...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The bank gives us Papi Greco. When Papi falls, one of his boys’1l flip, testify the money was planted in my account.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Or we could wait for the investigation to run its course.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The bosses already think I’m guilty. They’ll shuffle papers for six months then wipe their hands.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: And just when were you thinking of committing this act of lunacy?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing for lunch?  9/15/09 2guns 23.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You are completely hamstringing me on this.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m protecting you by giving you no other option. INT. STIG’S APARTMENT - DAY A highly unfinished loft in a rundown building. The space chopped up by dividers with windows along one whole wall. Stig lounges on a Goodwill sofa eating fistfuls of Fruit Loops and blowing shit up on X-box. 0.8. a fist POUNDS at the door. It’s Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Let’s hit the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ornate wall clock shows 12:55. The customers and tell go about their business oblivious to the impending storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby checks his guns. Stig holds up two Halloween masks: evil clown and Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Who you want, clown or Frankie?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Frankie.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You saying I’m a clown?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I'm kidding. You can have Frankie. Bobby considers Stig. An IMAGE flashes in Bobby’s mind:

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: BOBBY’S IMAGINATION - Bobby and Stig rush out of the bank right into the teeth of a DEA ambush.  9/15/09 2guns 24. Stig looks over at Bobby. Realizes Bobby has betrayed him Stig drops the money, levels his gun at Bobby... Only to cut down by a hail of DEA bullets.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You good?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Not gonna back out on me?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. Bobby and Stig pull on their masks and kick open the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business continues undisturbed as OUTSIDE THE WINDOW two in masks climb out of a van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig stride down the street... And right on pas the bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER DAVE (the native American desk officer) chats wit OFFICER PHIL (paunchy ex-marine).

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: «+-SO what’d you do with the Remington 22?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAVE
dialogues.text: I traded it to my cousin for an espresso machine.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: You need special beans for that? Bobby and Stig blow in, guns levelled.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: If you gentlemen will refrain from reaching for your firearms.  9/15/09 2guns 25.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How many other people in the building?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: Just Naomi and the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER DAVE
dialogues.text: Why’d you tell ‘em that? The CHIEF steps out of the back office nose in a magazine Stig grabs him, slams him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Easy.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: What the heck is this?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s a bank robbery. Only instead of robbing the bank then letting you chase us, we figured we’d come get you first. NAOMI (the office assistant) enters. The coffee cup drops from her hand. Shatters.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You must be Naomi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stig and Bobby lock the cops in a cell.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Think we should leave them some water?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Anybody thirsty? (no hands) They’re fine.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: They’re gonna be in there a while. Bobby sighs. Marches out. Then marches back in with a fla of water bottles which he drops by the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Can we go?  9/15/09 2guns 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig storm the bank. Bobby pins the guard, take his sidearm. Stig spidermans over the bullet proof glass corrals the tellers.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ladies behind the counter, keep your hands visible and off the alarms.

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: It’s all right, girls. Just give them the drawer cash.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (gun to the manager’s nose) Did we ask for the drawer cash? Stig spots the guard inching a hand toward an ankle holst

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guard. Bobby seamlessly whirls, kicks away the guard’s backup pi

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We are being polite about this. Sit tight. It’ll be over soon. Bobby tosses his backpack to Stig. Stig grabs the manager ushers him back to the LOCKED VAULT GATE.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: I don’t have the key. Stig rips open the manager’s shirt revealing a key on a lanyard. Dragging the manager by the lanyard, Stig unlock the gate then deposits the manager on his butt.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Sit fido. UP FRONT - Bobby notes a quivering FEMALE CUSTOMER. She i near tears. He leans down and whispers to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Just pretend you’re not here. Bobby’s empathy only makes the woman cry harder.  9/15/09 2guns 27.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sing a song. “Row, row, row your boat”? Go ahead. Row, row, row your boat...

dialogues.speaker: SCARED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Row, row, row your boat / gently down the stream...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Everybody. “Encouraged” by Bobby’s gun, the bank patrons join togeth in a shaky rendition of “Row, Row, Row Your Boat.” BACK IN THE VAULT - Stig hangs a net strung with magnetic charges across the wall of safe deposit boxes. Stig arms the detonator. The magnets activate attaching themselves the doors of the boxes. Stig retreats outside the vault.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Fire in the hole! BOOM! Smoke billows. Stig rushes back into the vault. The box doors are all blown off their hinges. Stig pulls out boxes. Both contain money-stuffed attache cases. Stig opens two more boxes. They also contain money-stuffe cases. As do the next two. And the next two. And the two after that.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, Frankie? Bobby edges back toward the vault. Sees Stig surrounded b cash-crammed attache cases.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re all filled with money.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I thought Papi only had two safe deposit boxes.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I got 18 and counting.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (grabbing the manager) Whose money is this?

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: I, I, I, please--  9/15/09 2guns 28.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Forget it. We take the money. Figure it out later. Stig grabs a stack of bank satchels and starts loading. Bobby returns to the MAIN ROOM. Out of Stig’s earshot he sidles up to the prostrate Security Guard.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Listen to me. When we leave, there’s gonna be police gunfire. When it hits, get everyone behind the counter. The guard nods, albeit warily. Stig emerges from the vaul toting five sacks of money.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: There are four more in the vault. Bobby hesitates, then goes to the vault, grabs the remain money. Together he and Stig march toward the front doors.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: BOBBY’S IMAGINATION - The image of Stig getting riddled b DEA gunfire plays over and over in Bobby’s mind...

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Bobby slows allowing Stig to drift ahead of him. Stig ban out the doors and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-Nothing. The street is quiet. No ambush. No cops. No DEA. Bobby is stunned to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Come on. Bobby, not knowing what else to do, follows Stig back to van. They heave the money in back and roar off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stig drives. Bobby reels. He just robbed a bank. Up ahead a two car caravan zooms at them. As the cars pass, Bobby spots Deb in the lead car with 4 WINDBREAKER CLAD DEA AGE  9/15/09 2guns 29. Bobby peers into his side mirror. The DEA caravan keeps right on going. Getting smaller and smaller.... INT. DEB'S CAR -— SAME

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Is this as fast as you can go? Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEA cars roll up on the bank. Deb sees the milling crowd, realizes they are too late to stop anything.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Keep going. (when the driver hesitates) You want the world knowing one of our guys just robbed a bank? Go. The DEA cars roll past the bank and off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but arroyos and scrub brush. Bobby and Stig peer into the van at the massive pile of money and attache cas Their expressions are of concern rather than joy.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We couldn’t just be the luckiest chumps on the face of the earth?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You feel lucky?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: How much you think is there?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Packs of hundreds, 60 packets per case. 70, 80 million? Stig punches the van. Walks away. Kicks the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Money like this, someone’s gonna come looking for it. Bobby braces for what he knows he has to do. On the sly h palms his DEA shield.  9/15/09 2guns 30.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (turning) I’ve got some bad news. I’m afraid you’ re-- REVEAL - Stig, gun leveled right at Bobby. Bobby hides hi badge before Stig can see it.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I really like you, you know?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I like you too.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. It’s okay. Nobody likes me.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That’s not true. You’re a likeable guy. Just put down the gun.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can’t. I’m sorry. Orders.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wait--

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta shoot you now.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No no no-- Stig shoots Bobby in the shoulder. Bobby tumbles to the d

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Dammit. Hell. I’m sorry, okay? Bobby gasps/moans. Stig feels like crap. He fetches a wat bottle from the van, sets it down beside Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you go. Stig spots Bobby’s shield laying in the dirt. Stig spit polishes it with his thumb.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sonofa... Damn, Bobby. Damn. Stig tosses the badge aside. Gets in the van and roars of Bobby tries to get to his knees. He collapses. Out.  9/15/09 2guns 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Naval Academy ring rests on the sink beside the mini- shampoos emblazoned with the name of the hotel: “Camino R El Paso.” Hands turn off the faucet and put the ring back on. The hands belong to THE ADMIRAL (U.S.N.).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral returns to the living room where the coffee t is piled with the stolen cash from the Tres Cruses S&L. REVEAL - Stig in the uniform of a Naval Petty Officer. Al present is SEAL MASTER CHIEF QUINCE. Stig snaps to and salutes. Quince pours coffee for the Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: That is an impressive mound of greenbacks.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Eighty-one million five hundred thirty two thousand.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: (to Quince) Recount the money, then pack it up. We'll stow it in my safe back in Corpus.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: My impression was we were supposed to come out of the bank with two million at most. The Admiral nods/mmm and sips his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, sir, it’d be polite if you showed at least a little surprise. Who’s money is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Bad men unworthy of it. Stig doesn’t like the Admiral’s non-answer but he’s an Admiral and Stig’s not.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Otherwise all went well?  9/15/09 2guns 32.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: 4-A, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: And Mr. Bobby Beans?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Put a bullet in him. Left him in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Dead?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: More than likely.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Your orders were to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: My orders were to shoot him. You never said “kill.”

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Son, the whole point of you partnering with Bobby Beans was to create a cut-out so the robbery couldn’t be traced back to us.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: My cover’s solid. There’s no way it’ll trace back.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: That’s a call made above your pay grade. Chief Quince take Petty Officer Stigman back out to the desert, make sure our cut-out’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: QUINCE
dialogues.text: Done and dusted, sir.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did you know he was a DEA agent?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: No. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No offense, but you really need to work on your “surprised” face.  9/15/09 2guns 33.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: If Bobby Beans was DEA, he helped you rob a bank which makes him dirty and for that I’ve got no mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby rouses. The sun blares down. His breath is labored.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get up, you stupid sonofabitch. Bobby wills himself to his feet. The landscape is empty t the horizon. He staggers forward. TIME BECOMES LIQUID... Bobby’s feet shuffling in the dirt His chest heaving... Blood seeping from his shoulder... D his arm... Bobby drops to all fours. Blood, his blood, drips to the arid ground and balls up like quicksilver. A shadow appears over Bobby. An a 11 YEAR-OLD MEXICAN BOY a played-out horse. The boy has a .22 rifle, and it’s aim right at Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: You coyote or drug runner?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m... I’m.a police officer.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Where’s your badge?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I lost it.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Coyotes left 6 people in the desert last week. Promised to get them across the border. Took their money, left them to die. Bobby can’t believe the absurdity of this.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m goddamn bleeding here.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Not my fault.  9/15/09 2guns 34. Bobby lunges for the boy’s rifle. The boy smacks Bobby wi the rifle butt and rides off. Bobby chases, but the boy j gallops further and further away until Bobby's legs give and he tumbles to the pavement -- yes, pavement -- as he collapsed along a two lane highway.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: MICKEY GALLAHAD rolls along in his 1995 pick-up with a ca top and an RV trailer in tow. Reaching into a paper bag h pulls out a newly purchased FLESHLIGHT (a flashlight-shap “sexual aid”). Mickey bites open the plastic and unzips.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: Come to daddy. Up ahead Mickey spots a blood-caked man laying in the mid of the road. It’s Bobby, of course. Mickey swerves and stomps the brakes. Climbing out, he hustles over. MICKEY (CONT’D) Jesus. Mister, are you okay? Bobby looks up at Mickey. At the fleshlight in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: This? It’s, um... Dang. It’sa pocket pussy. Bobby considers Mickey. Then simply pulls out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Bobby drives off in Mickey’s truck leaving Mickey by the of the road with his fleshlight and his RV trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARL FULLMAN (50, slim tie, silver western-style bracelet his wrist) washes his hands at the grimy sink.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: The United States is the greatest country in the world. Because we accept that man at his core is greedy, selfish, and covetous.  9/15/09 2guns 35. Earl rifles the cabinets. Finds a box of Lucky Charms. Pouring a bowl, he picks out the marshmallows and places in a tidy stack. In the F.G. sits a FIGURE tied to a chai

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t try to ameliorate these qualities, fence them in. We embrace them. We line everybody up, say, you’re on your own boys, grab all you can grab. That’s why we'll always win. Because we don’t fight the ugly truth of human nature. A THICK NECKED FELLOW with sunglasses and an ear piece en toting a satellite phone. Earl takes the handset.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah?... When?... How much did they get?... What was our money doing in a bank in New Mexico?... I’ll be on the next transport. Earl tosses the phone back to Agent Thick Neck.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pack it up. We’re out of here.

dialogues.speaker: THICK
dialogues.text: What about... Earl looks back at his “audience.” The man in the chair i blindfolded and naked with electrodes strapped to his bal

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Leave him as lunch meat for the rats. Earl exits. Agent Thick Neck and his LEAN partner follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATSY (19, chipper) bops to the latest groove on her iPod she coos at the dogs and the cats and even the iguana.

dialogues.speaker: PATSY
dialogues.text: Dinner time my cuties. Chester. Igor. How’s my Stumpy? Rounding the corner, Patsy comes up short. Propped agains the wall, in his blood-soaked shirt, is Bobby.  9/15/09 2guns 36.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You must be Dr. Ken’s new assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits on the table as a flustered DR. KEN inspects Bobby’s gunshot wound. Patsy loiters in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: Jesus, Bobby, Jesus, what am I supposed to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stitch me up, take the bullet out.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: I’m a vet not a trauma surgeon. Something like this, Jesus. You gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kenny, you remember offering to sell me 500 hits of Ketamine last month?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: You said you weren’t interested.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m a DEA agent, Kenny. And if you don’t stitch me up, I’m gonna tell the DA how you like to cruise Tori Amos concerts selling Special K to weepy college girls.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: You’re not a cop. Bobby grabs Dr. Ken, squishes his face against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. You have the right to have an attorney present during questioning. Do I keep going?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: Whatever, okay, I’1l do it.  9/15/09 2guns 37.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (to Patsy) Your boss is a real swell guy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: And you're the humanitarian of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quince picks Bobby’s shield up out of the dust. Over by t car, Stig watches Quince huddle with two more SEALs, MINI (who’s anything but) and TEEMO (compact, intense).

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: Blood trail heads off South- Southeast. There are a couple of deep washes but no sign of a body. Quince shoots a look at Stig then calls the Admiral. Gazing off, Stig spots a coyote. Wild and alone. The coyo gazes back, then suddenly takes off after a small critter All teeth and snarl.

dialogues.speaker: QUINCE
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to you. Stig takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL, (0.S. - ON THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: You’ve put us in quite a hole.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I don’t see it that way, sir, but you’re the man with the stars.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL, (0.S. - ON THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: All the pride I had in you, the way you conducted your mission, you tossed it to the wind. Stig is honestly stung by the Admiral’s disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I’m sorry, sir. In the warped reflection of the car windshield, Stig spot Mini coming up behind him, a black hood in hand.... Stig spins as Mini whips the hood over Stig’s head. Stig head butts Mini, smacks Mini face first against the car..  9/15/09 2guns 38. Teemo and Quince draw their guns. Stig dives over the hoo Bullets spray. Beneath the car Stig sees the feet of the SEALS moving to flank him. Stig sprints for a nearby arroyo. Ricochets chase his heels as he slides/tumbles into the wash. The fire-fight becomes hide & seek through the scrub pine Everyone moving fast and low. Quince spots Stig. Charges after him. Breaks through a stand of trees and -- WHAM -- Stig levels Quince with a branch. Quince kicks out and sweeps Stig’s legs. The two men grapple. Quince goes for Stig’s eyes with his thumbs. Stig bites Quince’s fingers. They roll apart. Quince clambers after his fallen pistol. Stig scrambles u out of the wash. Quince fires. Wide. The SEALs chase Stig up out of the wash but at the top th is no sign of him. A darting shadow draws the aim of all three men. The coyo Quince takes a shot at it in frustration. O.S. They hear the CAR ENGINE rev. Quince and the SEALs r back toward the car. But Stig and the car are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. The Admiral answers.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Whose money is it, sir? Must be somebody pretty scary.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You told me it was drug money. You told me there’d be two million and all of it would go to the families of the men we lost in Kashmir.  9/15/09 2guns 39.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I told you what you needed to hear to go through with the mission.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: The Navy taught me honor, sir. It taught me to fight the enemy and protect my own.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I think you’re under a mistaken impression.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Listen to me. We both love our country--

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Don’t. Please. I still believe in the values the Navy taught me, sir. I just don’t believe in you.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear that. I’m even more sorry to hear that you went AWOL 3 months ago and shot an MP.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did I kill him?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I haven't decided yet. You're the egg and I’m the wall, son. And when egg and wall come together, there’s only one ending to the story. The Navy’s grateful for your service. With that the Admiral hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars blockade the entrance. Earl pulls up with his aides, Thick and Lean. INT. TRES CRUCES SAVINGS & LOAN — CONTINUOUS The bank is abuzz with police and a handful of FBI Agents  9/15/09 2guns

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, gentlemen, this is a closed crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: We need to see the bank manager.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I’m nobody. I’m not even here. In fact I don’t even exist. A man in an FBI windbreaker steps up.

dialogues.speaker: FBI MAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: They want to see the manager.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You the Special Agent in Charge? (hands over a card) Here. Call this number. Tell the man who answers, “Earl says ‘hi.'” On the card is a phone number. Nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. The FBI man steps away to call the number on the card. the window, Earl notes the burnt out diner.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, when did that diner burn down?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: Two, three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: (to Thick) Get interviews with the wait staff. See if this and that are connected.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: It was just a grease fire.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Did I ask you your opinion, Gomer? 40. Out  9/15/09 2guns 41. The FBI man returns, highly shaken. Hands back the card.

dialogues.speaker: FBI MAN
dialogues.text: Give him whatever the hell he wants.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PHIL
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: FBI MAN
dialogues.text: He’s nobody. The FBI man walks off, wanting as much space between hims and Earl as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked up the street in Dr. Ken’s Mercedes (licence plate “PUSSDOC”), Bobby watches Deb drive out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby watches Deb head inside. He waits a beat then follo

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Camino Real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb steps onto the elevator. Just as the doors are closin Bobby jumps in. Pulls the emergency stop.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: A quickie with Harvey at the Camino Real? Now there’s a lovely way to spend the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Bobby, what the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I robbed a bank. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I was there with a squad of six agents at 1:03.  9/15/09 2guns 42.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You were late.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You were early. For Christ sake, you locked up the entire police department.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I didn’t want anyone getting hurt.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: So why didn’t you pull your own badge and stop it?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I did. Just before Stig shot me. Bobby flashes Deb the bloody dressing on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He set me up. He left me for dead, and I didn’t see it coming.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You've gotta turn yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I can't help myself if I’m in jail.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: It’s not you all alone against the world. It never has been.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I know that. Look, if I can find Stig and the money then at least I’ve got a story to sell. What I need from you is to take a second look at Stig’s background. See if there’s anything we missed, anything that might help track him.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’1l owe you.  9/15/09 2guns 43.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You’1ll always owe me. Bobby restarts the elevator and gets off at the next floo

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Tell Harvey I say “hi.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey Gallahad’s pick-up is parked outside. Mr. Lean pee in the driver’s side window. The seat is caked in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Thick blockades the door. Dr. Ken fidgets. Patsy chom her gum, kind of entertained by the excitement.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: This is ludicrous. I haven’t done anything. I have animals that need care. Dr. Ken makes like he’s going to march out the door. Thic stone reaction sends Dr. Ken back to his chair. Earl ente Whispers with Thick. Thick exits.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: So who'd you fix up last night?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: There’s a stolen car outside with blood all over the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know anything about that.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: All right. Earl pulls out a revolver, dumps out all six bullets.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ever play Russian Roulette? Course not, what am I thinking? Earl puts one bullet in the chamber, spins it, snaps it s  9/15/09 2guns 44,

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thing is most people put the gun to the temple, and that’s just stupid. What if the bullet’s in the first chamber? You blow a guy’s head off before he ever has a chance to tell you what you want to know. Earl puts the gun to Dr. Ken’s knee. Dr. Ken squirms. Ear pulls the trigger. BLAM! Dr. Ken howls.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Case in point. INT. STIG’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Bobby picks the lock, slips inside. He searches but finds little except for evidence of Stig’s poor housekeeping an love of sugar cereal. The phone RINGS. The machine picks up.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (O.S. - ON THE MACHINE)
dialogues.text: Pick up the phone... Come on, stop eyeballing my cereal and pick up the phone... Fine. The machine clicks off. A beat. Bobby’s cell RINGS. Bobby checks the caller ID. It’s Stig. Bobby answers.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (O.S. - ON THE PHONE)
dialogues.text: Thank you. First question, are you really DEA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burrowed under a tarp, Stig uses the scope atop a sniper rifle to watch Bobby through the windows of the loft.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Let me put the cuffs on you and you'll find out. STIG’S POV - Down on the street below, Quince, Mini, and Teemo approach Stig’s building.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Three very bad men just walked up to the building. If they catch you in my place they’re liable to get ugly.  9/15/09 2guns 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby races to the windows. Sees the SEALs below. Turning he hustles for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I swear to god, when I find you... STIG’S POV - In the lobby Quince and Teemo board the elev while Mini takes the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t take the elevator. Bobby turns for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t do the stairs either. There’s a goon named Mini on the way up. He won’t like you. Nowhere to go, Bobby retreats back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So just how dirty are you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s just you seem like a decent guy. I mean, you were willing to rob a bank but it’s not like you were a weasel about it. Bobby digs through the kitchen drawers for weapons. Finds large knife.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A knife to a gun fight? Come on, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: To your right, look at the toaster. Bobby looks. In the chrome reflection, he spots a red las dot in the middle of his forehead. Bobby dives for cover.  9/15/09 2guns 46.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna kill you. I like you. I just need to figure out if I can trust you.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You? Trust me? You shot me.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did I kill you? I could’ve killed you. In fact if I had killed you I wouldn’t be in this mess. STIG’S POV - Quince and Teemo step off the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, boy. Three bogies right outside the door. Your best chance is to head for the back bathroom. Ignoring Stig, Bobby hides behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? That’s a stupid place to hide. The door kicks open. The SEALS burst in. Bobby holds tigh Quince signals Teemo and Mini to disperse about the loft.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, we’ll do this the hard way. On my mark, cut low and left behind the chair.... Go. Bobby moves quick and low. Thanks to Stig’s timing the SE are all looking other directions.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next stop, around the bookshelf and beneath the bed... Go. Per Stig’s instruction, Bobby darts around the right side the bookshelf just as Quince comes the other direction ar the left side. Diving under the bed, Bobby just misses getting spotted by Teemo.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Roll right, crawl into the bathroom, hide in the tub. Now. Bobby rolls. Crawls into the BATHROOM. Climbs in the tub.  9/15/09 2guns 47.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Some people I used to work with. We had a philosophical falling out.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And now they want you dead?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I understand the feeling.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You're just mad ‘cuz you thought you were the one playing me. Admit it, I was good. Bobby starts to get out of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, not yet. Bobby waits. Quince passes by the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Why you? You were perfect. You don’t trust anyone, you don’t like anyone, you don’t have people so who’s gonna have your back when you fall? Another shadow slides past the doorway. Teemo this time.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, time to go. Step up onto the toilet and open the top half of the window. Bobby does as instructed.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now climb out and up onto the roof. Jutting out above the window is a stone ledge that Bobby have to free climb over if he’s to make the roof.  9/15/09 2guns 48.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What’s option 2?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s completely doable. I scoped this as an escape route myself.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You had two good arms. I’ve gota bullet hole in one of mine. Bobby looks at the ledge. No way. He climbs back in.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No, no, no, Bobby. You gotta go. Bobby ducks behind the door. Peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that. Bobby makes a break for the bed. Teemo spots him and unloads. Bobby sprawls. Stig opens fire. Windows shatter. Glass rains. Teemo is hit in the leg. Quince and Mini fire at Bobby but with Stig pinning them they can’t get an angle on him. Bobby breaks for the kitchen island. Stig covers him with sweeping volley. Quince unleashes a volley out the window at Stig. Stig returns fire which allows Bobby to dash out the door. INT. STAIRWELL — CONTINUOUS Bobby whips down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stig retreats and climbs down the fire escape. EXT. STIG’S BUILDING - SAME Bobby sprints outside. A car squeals up. The passenger do kicks open. It’s Stig.  9/15/09 2guns 49.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Get in. Bobby levels his gun at Stig. Stig stomps the gas and spe off. Bobby fires at Stig’s car blowing out the rear tire. Stig spins out, smacks head on into a parked car. Climbing out, Stig hustles away on foot. Bobby chases him around the corner, only to have Stig seemingly vanish. Bo looks around. Notes a ROWDY, PACKED BAR....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on alert, Stig hunches over a beer near the back of bar. Out of nowhere a pretty young thing named SUSIE flop into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE
dialogues.text: You wanna have sex?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (completely flummoxed) I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE
dialogues.text: Knock boots? You know, go back to my place and make sweet, sweet monkey love? Stig stammers, topples his glass, mops at the spilled bee

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, your friend gave me fifty bucks to do that.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Friend? Bobby slides into the booth beside Stig, beer in one hand gun jabbed into Stig’s ribs under the table with the othe

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hi. Thanks, Susie. You can take off.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No, stay.  9/15/09 2guns 50.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Now Bruce, you promised you’d come dancing with me.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Not tonight, honey.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You wanted me to go to the movies with you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: That was different. The movies don’t involve you putting me in handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna let you two work this out. Susie leaves Stig and Bobby to their “lover's spat.” Bobb jabs Stig with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Question one: whose idea was it to plant the 100k in my account, yours or Papi Greco?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What 100k?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wrong answer.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Why would I be working with Papi Greco when it was his money we were stealing.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Because it wasn’t actually his money.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: True, but I didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So who’s money was it?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but the guys in my apartment are willing to kill you and me to keep us from finding out.  9/15/09 2guns 51. BOBBY & STIG’S POV - Across the bar Susie relates her encounter to her girlfriends. The girls titter and gawk.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you involved a civilian. That is so outside the lines.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What lines?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Rules of engagement.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Rules of... What are you military? (realization) Oh, Jesus. You're military.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can’t really say. If I could trust you weren’t dirty, maybe I could, but I don’t, so I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're part of a military conspiracy to rob a bank, and you're worried that I’m dirty?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You robbed the bank too.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t trying to get away with it. My people were supposed to arrest us aS soon as we accessed the safe deposit boxes.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So wait, the robbery, you were just setting me up?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It had nothing to do with you. I was trying to bust Papi Greco for tax evasion.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Thanks, really. It’s good to know, me spending 20 years in jail was a complete afterthought to you.  9/15/09 2guns 52.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, just who shot who here? Come on. Let’s go. Bobby prods Stig. Shifting as if to rise, Stig knocks Bobby's beer into his lap. Bobby flinches the tiniest bit but it’s enough for Stig get his own gun out and jab it i Bobby’s ribs. Now they both have guns.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you didn’t see that coming. How did you not see that move coming?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I guess I just missed it. OVER BY THE FRONT DOOR - Quince enters, scans the bar. Bo and Stig both see him. Uh-oh. Without warning Stig rears back and decks Bobby. Bobby sprawls.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You slut. How could you sleep with Ricardo? The bouncers instantly descend on Stig while at the same the tightly packed crowd blockades Quince.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all right, I’m leaving, I’m out. Stig hurries out the back. Bobby scrambles to go after hi

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Let him go, buddy. There’s plenty of fish in the sea. Bobby pulls loose. Slams out the back door into --

dialogues.speaker: THE ALLEY BEHIND THE BAR -
dialogues.text: There is no sign of Stig. Bobby curses.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE -
dialogues.text: Quince shoulders through the crowd, but by the time he ge

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE -
dialogues.text: 9/15/09 2guns 53. Bobby like Stig before him has vanished. INT. JESSUP’S HOUSE - NIGHT A modest home on a modest street. Jessup, (Bobby’s boss a DEA) fixes a whiskey and pepto. 0O.S. a KNOCK at the door It’s Earl. Without invitation Earl bulls past Jessup insi

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You've got a nice place. Unpretentious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Where’s our money?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You think DEA can just waltz into our bank, steal our money, and we're not gonna kick?

dialogues.speaker: JESSUP
dialogues.text: Get out of my house. Jessup goes to grab the pistol in his desk drawer.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. A GUN COCK freezes Jessup in his tracks. REVEAL - Behind Jessup is Mr. Thick. (Thick snuck in through the patio do while Jessup was at the front door with Earl). Mr. Lean slips in through kitchen door and joins the party.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the drawer, please. (Jessup closes the drawer) Your man, Bobby Beans -- Bobby Trench stole 81 million of our dollars. We want them back. Because it’s our money; and because it’s a blatant act of disrespect; and because it’s our money.  9/15/09 2guns 54. INT. BOBBY’S TOWNHOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE ON - The phonebook left behind by Papi Greco. A han reaches in and picks it up. It’s Stig. Wandering the townhouse, Stig calls Bobby’s cell phone. He gets voicema

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Hey, Bobby. It’s me. I wanted you to know, I broke into your place. Don’t worry, there’s no busted glass. The lock on your patio door’s kinda shot but... Anyway I didn’t want you getting paranoid. Stig considers the blank slate feel of the townhouse. Bas furniture. Bare walls. Nothing personal anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To tell the truth I expected plusher digs from the man who can get anyone anything. But that was just the part you were playing, right? Stig checks Bobby’s drawers, cabinets, closets.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought for a sec maybe you were going for a whole ascetic statement, but for that you’d have to have like one bad jazz CD you played over and over. Beneath the carpeting at the rear of the linen closet, St finds a stash hole. Hidden inside are Bobby's only person effects. His DEA credential, a few photos, a snow globe o the twin towers, a Justice Department commendation medal.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Commendation for exceptional service in the public interest.” Stig considers a PHOTO of a pissed off teenage Bobby stan with his father, a Marine Corps Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me your dad was a jarhead? It explains everything. The surliness, the cranky attitude. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not to be over the line but you don't look like you had the happiest of childhoods. Stig considers a photo of Bobby from his time as a Chicag Police Officer, his bearing all righteousness and rectitu

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway the real question is how deep into your part did you go? Did Papi actually set you up or was the bank the big score that would set you free? The phone line BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: ELECTRONIC VOICE ON PHONE
dialogues.text: If you are happy with your message, press one. If you would like to erase your message and start over, press two. Stig thinks. Then hits 2 and erases his message. INT. DEB’S CUBICAL, DEA - NIGHT Deb broods at her desk. Everyone except the cleaning crew has gone home. Her phone rings. She grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Tell me it’s you.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. DR. KEN’S MERCEDES - PARKED - LATE NIGHT Bobby tests his wounded shoulder. Not good. He pops three vidicon, swallows them dry.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You find anything new on Stig?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: He came up clean in every data base I’m cleared for. To go deeper I'd need clearance from Jessup.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So no military connection, record of service?  9/15/09 2guns 56.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: No. Why, what are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Somebody burned me to Papi Greco. Somebody convinced him to put that money in my account to make sure I’d go through with the robbery.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Stig.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig didn’t even know I was DEA. Besides he’s got people trying to kill him too. (beat) It’s like I’m drowning in quicksand.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Do you think it ever could've worked between us? If we’d really given it a try?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I’m not sure what answer you want to hear. Neither is Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It could've been nice, right?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: It wouldn’t have been you. She's right. And it’s a truth that hurts.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Look, whatever happens I promise I'll leave you out of it. We never talked, I never called, you don’t even know me. Bobby hangs up. Deb calls him right back.

dialogues.speaker: STAYING WITH BOBBY -
dialogues.text: 9/15/09 2guns 57. Deb’s call registers on Bobby’s phone. Bobby hits “ignore and climbs out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby strides up the street, knocks on the door of a hous The door is opened by Mr. Lean. This is Jessup’s house. A at once and with startling swiftness -- INT. JESSUP’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Lean reaches for his gun. Bobby lunges at Lean. They tussle. Lean’s gun discharges - BLAM. The shot momentarily distracts Earl and Thick allowing Je to go for the gun in the desk. Thick pistol whips Jessup. Jessup goes down but gets off a wild shot. Earl whirls an pumps two into Jessup’s chest. Lean knees Bobby in the balls. Slams Bobby to the floor. Jessup’s eyes meet Bobby’s. They are filled with the pani of a man who knows he is dying. Bobby thrashes but Lean keeps Bobby’s head pinned to the floor. Earl spits a curse. Marches over to Thick, chops him in t throat, snatches his gun, drops him with an elbow.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: That is how you take down a man with a gun. With a surprising tenderness, Earl bends over Jessup.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all right. There’s no turning back. Let it come. Jessup gasps. And dies.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dust to dust. (a beat - to Bobby) You took our money. Bobby grits his teeth and refuses to look at Earl.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at me, not at him.  9/15/09 2guns 58.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Can you imagine the hidden hand of God? Well, I’m God’s sonofabitch. Earl takes out a pen knife.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who at DEA authorized you to steal our money? Bobby is mum. Earl twists the knife into Bobby’s wound. Bobby howls.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re gonna tell me, so just tell me. Who authorized you to steal our money?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I was freelancing. I was off the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: And you just happened to pick our bank?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I thought it was drug money. I thought it belonged to Papi Greco.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: And who gave you that idea?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig, Mark Stigman. He set me up then he shot me.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: And the money?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: So no idea? Nothing at all? Or if pressed, might you suddenly find inspiration as to where to look?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sure.  9/15/09 2guns 59.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You know what you are? You’re a dirty DEA agent who robbed a bank and murdered your boss. You walk into any police station, any federal office, that’s the story they’re gonna have. Unless... you bring me 81.53 million dollars. Earl pulls out a sharpie. Writes 81.53 on Bobby’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
