dialogues.text: 81.53 million and he’s a suicide. 81.53 and you walk away clean. Have I properly incentivized you? Then get after it. Go on. Bobby staggers to his feet. Earl tucks his card in Bobby’ pocket. Bobby looks back at Jessup’s body.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re thinking he deserved better, you’re right. EXT. JESSUP’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Bobby hustles back to his car. A beat. He punches the steering wheel, the roof, the seats. His rage ebbs. He's still fucked. He throws the car in gear and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 7-series BMW sits parked in front of an expansive but n gaudy home. Beside the BMW, smoking a cigarette, is Ferre Nose Julio. A hand taps Julio on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hola. Bobby pistol whips Ferret-Nose Julio. Julio drops like a of rocks as his cigarette goes spinning through the air.. INT. CHILD’S ROOM, NICE HOUSE - NIGHT CESAR (age 7) sits in bed cradling a jackknife. His fathe Papi Greco, opens the knife and shows him how to hold it.  9/15/09 2guns 60.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Hold it firm but not tight. A knife is a tool. You treat it with respect. Cesar’s mother, DAISI (sensuous and lovely) watches from door. Tucking Cesar in, Papi crosses to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAISI, (IN SPANISH)
dialogues.text: He misses you.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO, (IN SPANISH)
dialogues.text: And I miss you. But you're safer in El Paso than Juarez where half the police are owned by my enemies. Papi gives her a heartfelt kiss and a cash roll. EXT. DAISI’S NICE HOUSE - NIGHT Bobby hogties Julio, stows him in the bushes. Climbing behind the wheel of Papi’s car, Bobby hunkers low and wai IN THE REFLECTION IN THE SIDE MIRROR - Bobby watches Rudy Papi emerge from the house.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Let's get moving, Julio. I want to be back across the border by dawn. Bobby fingers his pistol as Papi’s hand reaches to open t car door... Suddenly out of nowhere. An ENGINE. HEADLIGHTS. Rudy and Papi whirl as a car barrels up on to the lawn. Plows into Rudy. Rudy is tossed into the shrubs. Stig leaps out of the car. Snatches Papi. Smacks his head on the roof. Slings him into the trunk. Bobby jumps from the BMW, levels his gun. Stig whirls--

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Jesus, you scared me.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Kidnapping Papi Greco.  9/15/09 2guns 61.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Gimme your keys.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Why, you afraid what he’s gonna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. It’s just I got my own questions for Papi Greco and I got here first.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You can have him when I’m done.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The gun says I don’t wait in line. Stig drops the keys down the front of his pants.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Come and get ‘em. POP - Bobby socks Stig in the nose with his gun butt. Sti staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was uncalled for. Bobby aims his pistol at Stig’s crotch.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m aiming for the left one, but even at this range I might clip both. Stig gives. With a shimmy/shake his leg he maneuvers the keys down his pantleg onto his shoe top.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You know, I liked you better when you were I-Know-A-Guy Bobby. That Bobby was a good guy. I trusted that Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I liked you better when you were a two-bit thief with a chip on your shoulder. Stig kicks the keys high in the air and surges at Bobby. BLAM - Bobby fires a shot into the pavement between Stig’ legs. Stig freezes.  9/15/09 2guns 62.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Saw that move coming?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So what now? One of us is gonna have to pick up the keys. A beat. 0O.S. From inside the trunk, Papi Greco thumps an curses. Still neither makes the first move. Across the lawn, Rudy pulls himself up onto one elbow and fires his Uzi. Bullets spray. Stig and Bobby dive. As Bobby returns fire, Stig grabs the keys, jumps in the and speeds off. Bobby curses, jumps in the BMW, and chase

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HIGHWAY- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bobby speeds down the road, his headlights blaring in Sti rear view. Sliding up tight, he whacks Stig’s bumper. Sti ignores the hit and floors it through traffic. Bobby stay right on him. They bang, they bump, they bash. Bobby pulls alongside Stig and aims his gun out the windo Stig’s head. Stig stomps the brakes and swerves/spins acr the median, across oncoming traffic, and off down a dirt access road. Bobby throws the BMW into a power slide, gets clipped by oncoming traffic, but keeps right on after Stig. Gravel sprays as Bobby chases Stig away from the highway, away from the lights, down smaller and smaller roads. Stig flips a U-turn and takes off cross-country through t cottonwood. Bobby tracks after him. Deeper and deeper out into nowhere. Amid the dust all Bobby can see is the red of Stig’s tail lights. He is driving blind. Trees flash out of blackness He swerves and dodges. He will not give up the chase. Stig cuts left around a stand of scrub pine. Bobby cuts right. The cars separate, then pivot and charge at each other. It’s a game of chicken. Lights rush at lights. The are about to smash head on when --  9/15/09 2guns 63. Both men veer at the last moment. Stig goes nose first in a ditch. Bobby goes head on into a cactus. The two men tumble from their cars. Bobby throws a haymaker at Stig. Stig slips the punch. Bo men tumble to the dirt. A beat. There they sit in the dus glow of their headlights. Gassed. A beat. Stig laughs.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Come on, that was kinda fun. Almost despite himself, Bobby lets a half-smile slip out.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You’re insane.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Nah. I’m Naval Intelligence. Or was. The Admiral FUBARed my jacket so I’m listed 3 months AWOL.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You’re lucky. They’ve got me killing my boss.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did you? Bobby chucks a pebble at Stig.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we're both innocent? Innocent and completely screwed?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Unless you can prove you were under orders when you robbed the bank.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Nope. You?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Technically I wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: That’s hard core. They both chuckle. Bonded by their communal fucked-ness.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So what'd you want with our boy in the trunk?  9/15/09 2guns 64.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You said he set you up to look dirty. I figured I’d check your story, see if I could really trust you. You?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Somebody tipped him I was DEA. I thought if I could get him to tell me, I could slip the noose, track down the money, escape. Stig grabs the keys from his car and flips them to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you better ask him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: When this is over, I’m still gonna shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Do you really think that’s gonna make you feel better?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do. Bobby pops the trunk. Twisted up inside, Papi Greco is ca with spittle and vomit.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did he puke? I think he puked.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It was a bouncy ride. (to Papi) Who told you I was DEA?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Was it the Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Sure, it was the Admiral, fuck you both.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I don’t think it was the Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This might take a while. Bobby slams the trunk.  9/15/09 2guns 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls a makeshift blindfold off Papi’s head. Papi i bound to a lawn chair with extension cords.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How do you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We could waterboard him?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t we need like equipment?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Just a couple buckets and some plastic wrap.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You won't do it. The United States Government doesn’t torture.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m persona non grata with the government, so I don’t feel particularly compelled to follow their rules.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We should at least give him a chance tell us.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I hope you like the taste of balls, ‘cuz I’m gonna cut yours off, stuff ‘em in your mouths. Or maybe I'11l put yours in his and his in yours.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I‘ll go find the plastic wrap.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: When you set me up, did you know I‘d rob the Tres Cruces?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: The Tres Cruces? You robbed the Tres Cruces?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We thought we were robbing you.  9/15/09 2guns 66. Papi burst out laughing. He howls.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know it was so funny.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You're dead, you’re both dead and I don’t even have to kill you. Glee was not the reaction Bobby and Stig expected. Bobby slaps Papi. But even that fails to dampen Papi’s mood. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) How much you get?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (a look to Stig, he lies) Two million.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I thought you were sharp. Mr. Bobby Beans. But you, you ripped off the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Why would you be stashing money in the same bank as the CIA?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: What money? The only money I ship to that bank are my payments. Stig and Bobby trade a confused look. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We're kinda slow. So how ‘bout you lay it out piecemeal?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You don’t know? The CIA, they skim off 7% of my revenue. In return they “let” me fly my shit across the border -- not that I was having any problems with that. They take a piece from all the cartels. It’s goddamn imperialism.  9/15/09 2guns 67.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: He’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m lying. I’ma liar. They’re still gonna kill you. The garage door KA-CLUNKS. Bobby and Stig whirl guns leve as scrolls upward revealing DEB’S CAR.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Bobby? INT. DEB’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Bobby placates Deb while Stig pokes through the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You kidnap a drug kingpin and tie him up in my garage?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Mind if I swipe a yogurt?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to leaving me out of this?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Jessup’s dead. That hits Deb like a ton of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The CIA, it was their money. They came looking for it.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: (sinks into a chair) Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get some air. Stig exits out the patio door.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: How did this get so messed up? (swatting Bobby) You bastard. Deb swats at Bobby again. Bobby takes it.  9/15/09 2guns 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral is at the podium giving a power point presentation to 500 military/government types.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Outdated force-projection paradigms must be abandoned if the Navy is to embrace the new reality of asymmetrical combat. We must shake off the rust and refocus on those areas where non-state actors and criminal enterprise intersect: Somali pirates, weapons smugglers, narcotraffickers. Slide. (re: the new slide) A submarine. Under construction in middle of the Columbian jungle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Admiral strides outside. Mini and 4 other SEALs (LUCA KELVIN, SANGER, and GOMEZ) wait by an SUV. Laid out in ba is Teemo, a field dressing on his leg.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Has Chief Quince reported in?

dialogues.speaker: MINI
dialogues.text: Still out hunting.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: What he hunts, he finds. So be ready. How’s Teemo?

dialogues.speaker: MINI
dialogues.text: Bullet missed the femoral artery but... The Admiral checks Teemo’s leg. It’s not good.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You hanging in there?

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: I was thinking, sir, maybe Mini could take me to the base hospital, say it was a training accident?  9/15/09 2guns 69.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You know procedure. The boys would be tied up with questions for days. We have to settle things with Stigman and the cut-out first.

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: Right. Of course. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You need anything more for the pain?

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: No, sir. I’m strong.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You have my admiration and my respect. Teemo beams. The Admiral’s respect is better than morphin The Admiral’s phone RINGS. He steps away to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: EXT. BACK YARD, DEB’S HOUSE - NIGHT Stig huddles out of Bobby and Deb’s sight.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’‘ll take you 6 minutes to trace this call. I'll be off in 3 so don’t bother.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t think of it. The Admiral motions to Mini - “Trace this call.”

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Was it CIA money?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: (a beat, then the truth) Off the books money earned from drug dealers.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Fight the enemies of America.  9/15/09 2guns 70.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: As defined by you.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Who better?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Do you even care about the families of the men we left behind?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Money won’t bring back the dead. What it will do is allow us to take the battle to enemy without constraint or remorse.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Or oversight?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: We are at war.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Not with the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: With Muslim extremists. With petro- dictators. With an ignorant Congress that forces the Navy to account for every penny while the CIA finances an off-the-books slush fund with money extorted from Papi Greco and a dozen other druglords.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So you decided to hijack their off- the-books slush fund and use it to run rogue ops?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I am charged with protecting the people of this nation. And what the people want is to lay safe in their beds untroubled by the moral compromises required to achieve that safety. If I thought you understood... Bobby appears behind Stig.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to?  9/15/09 2guns 71.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I was just confirming Papi’s story.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (snatching Stig’s phone) Give me that. (to the Admiral on phone) Give me one reason I shouldn’t go to the CIA, tell them you’re behind this whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Because they’1l kill you anyway. Whereas I’m going to give you what you really want, a chance to clear your name.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You work in the field, Agent Trench. You understand the difference between what looks black and white on paper and the reality of getting things done. I know the frustration you carry: the DEA asking you to fight the wolves on their own turf, then making you do it in handcuffs. The Admiral's got Bobby down. Not that Bobby would admit

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're making me misty.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I'll see that Petty Officer Stigman takes the full fall for the robbery, and I‘ll guarantee you protection from the CIA. All have to do is give me your location. My men will take care of the rest. Bobby considers Stig who has no idea of the Admiral offer

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Throw in a million dollars and you've got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Done.  9/15/09 2guns

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Two million.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: You said one.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: This isn’t a game, Agent Trench.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Three’s about to become four.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You know what? I’d rather let Stig cut your throat. Bobby hangs up, tosses the phone back to Stig.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go check on Papi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papi Greco is gagged and still tied to the chair. checks that the cords are tight.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Snug as a bug in a rug. Stig notes the side door to the garage is ajar. to investigate. Outside all is clear when -- A LIGATURE flips around Stig’s neck from behind. 72. Stig He crosses Quince. Stig thrashes. Tries to call out but can’t get air. INT. DEB'S KITCHEN —- SAME

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: How can you possibly trust a thing Stig says to you? He’s a lunatic.  9/15/09 2guns 73.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t. I don’t even like the guy. But he’s the help I’ve got.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Stig kicks his heel into Quince’s knee. The two men toppl into Papi knocking him over in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stig?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Quince has his arm across Stig’s throat preventing a response. Stig claws at Quince’s eyes. They bang against the shelves. Garden tools go clattering. Papi strains to grab a fallen pair of clippers. Stig gouges Quince in the throat. The two men tumble/cras out the SIDE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (marching for the garage) What are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Papi cuts himself free and dashes out the door just as Bo enters from the kitchen. Bobby sees the empty garage. Rac back through the house to Deb --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stig and Papi are gone.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Gone where? CRASH - Stig’s body comes flying through the plate glass patio door. Stig rolls onto his back and empties his pistol out at th yard. A return volley POP-POP-POPS out of the dark. Bobby Deb, and Stig scramble for cover.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How many?  9/15/09 2guns 74.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Quince, maybe a few others. Papi?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Gone. More shots POP-POP-POP. Bobby and Stig return fire.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You wanna take the left or the right?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We should split out the other way, go for the car.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Bad guys are out back.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And this place will surrounded by cops in about two minutes. Another volley rains in from the dark. Taking control, De dashes for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we go?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You never want to stay and fight. Laying down covering fire, Stig and Bobby follow Deb as ricochets zing around them. EXT. DEB’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Stig, Bobby, and Deb race out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Fine, but I’m driving. (when Bobby balks) Hey, you brought us here and see how well that turned out. Bobby gives. They pile in, Stig at the wheel, and speed o  9/15/09 2guns 75. EXT. MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER - EARLY MORNING An old school dive. Stig pulls into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Getting breakfast. They make a dynamite omelet, and their pancakes aren’t bad either. INT. MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER —- EARLY MORNING Bobby, Deb, and Stig huddle at a back booth. Aside from a few long-haul truckers they have the place to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You have to turn yourselves in.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And say what? “We didn’t really rob a bank, it was an off the books CIA slush fund, and we didn’t really even mean to get away with robbing it.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I meant to.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Not helping. A pretty, young waitress (SHAUNA by her tag) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUNA
dialogues.text: Y’all had a chance to look at your menus?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We'll take three coffees and a couple of minutes. Shauna retreats.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need proof. Proof I was set up, proof he was acting under orders.  Sure. 9/15/09 2guns 76.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Having our mitts on the money wouldn’t hurt either.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You have a plan for all this?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY STIG
dialogues.text: No. Bobby shoots Stig a glare.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: She asked a question. Shauna returns with the coffees. Stig gives her a respect nod as she retreats once more.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: All right. That’s twice she’s been here and you haven’t winked at her either time.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So? (caught) She’s the cousin of an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: A Navy friend?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Tim Corrales. His mother owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Aw, christ, what have you walked us into?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Okay? We served in SEAL Team Six together. He died on a mission that never happened in a country we were never in. His family was told it was a car crash. (beat) The Admiral lied and said the two million from the Tres Cruces would go to his mother and the families of the other men we lost. Bobby sees the emotional burden Stig is carrying.  9/15/09 2guns 77.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess I’m just a bleeding heart sucker.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yup. MAMA MAYBELLE emerges from the kitchen, sees Stig, and bu out in a big opened arm smile.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA MAYBELLE
dialogues.text: Marcus, how dare you sit down in my restaurant without giving me a hug first? INT. KITCHEN, MAMA MAYBELLE’S DINER - LATER Stig flamboyantly works the flattop under Mama’s iron fis supervision. Bobby and Deb watch from stools at the count

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Look, Bobby, if you come with me, I think -- think I can convince the U.S. Attorney you went along on the robbery because you were trying to stop it. There’s the Papi Greco angle, and you did get shot.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What about Stig?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: He’d have to take his chances with the grand jury.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So I’d be hanging him out to dry?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You'd be putting an end to this madness. And you'd be clearing your name. Bobby glances over at Stig. What to do?

dialogues.speaker: DEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know by all rights I should walk away and let you drown?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And validate my cynical world view? No chance.  9/15/09 2guns 78. Bobby wins a smile. He likes that smile.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, if I was the suave type, I’d take your hand, tell you to ditch Harvey. Run away with me to a grass hut in the South Seas.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: His name’s not Harvey. And I'd know you were lying.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Maybe I’m not. And indeed maybe he isn’t. OVER AT THE FLATTOP - Stig watches Bobby and Deb. The way she touches his arm, the way he leans in to her. Deb rise heads for the door. EXT. GAS STATION ACROSS THE HIGHWAY — DAY Deb approaches the pay phone. She considers her reflectio in the chrome around the keypad. She dials. INT. MAMA MABELLE’S DINER - DAY

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You had us stash a kidnapped drug lord in the garage of your ex- girlfriend? That is messed up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She was never my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Did you two... Bobby’s non-answer gives Stig his answer.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like I said, “Messed up.” Mama Maybelle thrusts a breakfast plate at Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA MAYBELLE
dialogues.text: Over easy with a side of pancakes.  9/15/09 2guns 79.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You tell her how I feel about pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: MAMA MAYBELLE
dialogues.text: He told me but it’s my place and in my place everyone eats a good breakfast. How can Bobby say no? Maybelle pats Bobby’s head and retu to the kitchen. Bobby considers Stig, decides be square.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Deb’s calling the U.S. Attorney. She thinks she can get me off. She isn’t sure about you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What’d you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: If you turn yourself in, you could get royally screwed.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Worse than I am already?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Depends how you feel about federal prison.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (stunned/wounded) You're throwing me to the lions?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m giving you a choice. If you want to go, there’s the door. If it were me, I'd take my chances with the U.S. Attorney.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You and I aren’t in this together, are we?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You're just doing what you gotta do, right? The rest is just stuff that makes you stupid.  9/15/09 2guns 80. Swallowing his hurt, Stig returns to the flattop.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Order up. Bobby feels like a heel. Glancing around the restaurant h notes that the place is dead empty.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said order up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Didn’t there used to be customers. Uh-oh. Stig and Bobby both pull their guns. Shauna emerges from the bathroom. Stig motions for her to stay put as he and Bobby ease over to the front window. OUT IN THE PARKING LOT - are 5 well armed, Mexican toughs

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Papi Greco's?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You want the ones on the left or the right?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Let’s see if we can split out the back.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You wanna split out the back? You never want to split out the back. Stig nods toward Shauna and Maybelle. Bobby gets it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ladies, we need you to go back to the walk-in and lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s all right Mama. Mama and Shauna go. Bobby and Stig hustle out the back -- EXT. BACK DOOR, MAYBELLE’S DINER - CONTINUOUS -- only to be confronted by a dozen shotgun barrels wield Papi Greco and a dozen of his boys.  9/15/09 2guns 81.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Looks like we flushed a couple of rabbits. Papi clubs Bobby with his shotgun. Bobby goes down. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) Take ‘em and skin him.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: 80 million dollars. (Papi stops.) 81.53 actually. It’s what we stole from the CIA. We lied and said two but it’s really 81.53. Million.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: 81.53 million?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Yours for the taking.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But he does. He took it and hid it somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Sure, you did.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Shut up and agree with me before they decide to kill you and keep me alive.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I hid the money.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Actually, I’m the one who hid it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You just said I hid it.  9/15/09 2guns 82.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Well, one of us did. Papi considers Bobby. Then Stig. Then 81.53 million dollars. Papi clubs Stig. Stig joins Bobby on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Take them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greco's boys frog-march Bobby and Stig around the diner. Bobby spots Deb hiding across the street. He waves her of with a shake of his head. Deb nods and scuttles away. Bob and Stig are thrown in a car trunk. The lid slams. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby’s head is shoved into a trough of fetid water. He burbles, thrashes, is yanked back up. He gasps. Papi’s fi clocks him. He is shoved back under. Burble/gurgle/gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greco’s boys toss Bobby inside. He lands with a thud. Sti sits sulking against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Deb knows where we are. We just have to hold out until she can call in the cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We’re 300 miles south of the border. By the time she gets through the red tape we’ll be dead.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That's a positive mental attitude.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You were gonna sell me out to the U.S. Attorney.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s kind of a moot point.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m not talking to you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sulks a beat and then) What did I ever do to you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Besides shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Know what you are? You're a misanthrope.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: It’s from the Greek. It means you don’t actually like people.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I know what it means.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Well, in case you didn’t. Stig lays down with his back to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're just lucky Papi couldn't resist the lure of 80 million dollars. I’d be dead, but you, he’d be torturing you just for fun.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Lucky me.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m serious. If it was 5 million, he’‘d be smart. But 80? He’s got the fever.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And when he figures out we don’t actually have the money?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: He’ll chop our feet off, pluck out our eyeballs and generally kill us.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well, at least we’ll see the sunrise. For a beat they lay in silence.  9/15/09 2guns 84.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You ever see the sunrise off an aircraft carrier at sea?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You ever see the sunrise off Miami Beach after you’ve been up all night?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Drinking mojitos with a beautiful woman who’s wearing your jacket and leaning against your shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Margaritas. No jacket.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m not good with women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors fling open. Sunlight floods in. Two goons snatc Stig and haul him out. A beat. Two more goons appear.

dialogues.speaker: GOON
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig are on their knees, hands bound in front o them. Papi is over by the corner, pissing on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: My grandfather cut cane every day for 30 years, never got a blister. He’d say it smells like hell but it toughens the hands. Zipping up, Papi wrenches an ax handle in his powerful gr PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) You know what’s nice about this, Bobby? This time I don’t have to worry about leaving marks.  9/15/09 2guns 85. Papi whacks Bobby across the back. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) There is an opportunity here for one of you to buy your life back. The longer you wait the less life there’s gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Go jerk yourself off. Papi jabs Stig with the ax handle, then chokes him with i Stig’s eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Think about the money, Papi. Revenge is personal. Money's money.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: What money? You keep talking about this phantom money.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: 81 million dollars. Papi releases Stig. Stig topples forward.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI. GRECO
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Corpus Christi Naval Air Station.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Improvising. (to Papi) The money’s on the base at Corpus. But only for another 2 days max. After that it’s gone, and you might as well kill us.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: If you’re telling the truth, I might as well kill you.  9/15/09 2guns 86.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can get the money. In return you let me live. And you give me 5%.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: He gets nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I’l1l think about it. (re: Bobby) Strap this one to the table and get my chain saw. I got a nice one. The goons go to grab Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You can’t. I need him. Corpus is a big place, not to mention all the guards with rifles.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I’m just supposed to let you walk out of my sight and trust you'll come back with the money.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Where we gonna go? The cops want to arrest us, the CIA wants to kill us. You're our best friend. As Papi ponders this, Ferret-Nose Julio enters and whispe in Papi's ear. Whatever he says, it gives Papi real pause

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Take them upstairs, get ‘ema shower. They smell like chicken shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up. Ferret-Nose Julio steps up to greet the n arrivals. The arrivals are Earl and his two aides. EXT. GRECO’S RANCH - DAY Earl and Papi watch the vaqueros herd cattle. Earl scoops some pebbles. Tosses them one by one.  9/15/09 2guns 87.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You hear about the Tres Cruces?

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Saw a TV report. Earl hands over photos of Bobby and Stig.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: The thieves came from your organization.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: They're freelancers. Americans. And that one’s a cop.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I’m not asking for their resumes. I want you to find my money.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: There a finders fee on this?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: The fee is you get to stay in business with us.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You think all us Mexicans we’re just dying to mow your lawn? To stand outside Home Depot in the rain? “Please Mister, give me a job.”

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I think those men in the rain just want the best life possible.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You like my country weak and corrupt, so you can have cheap labor. I’m not cheap.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Is this about pride, Manny? Prove you have a big Mexican cock? Your cock is huge. It’s massive. A record holder. And I... am in awe. So what? You think we can’t just reach across the border, scoop you up like a handful of dust and -- Earl blows the dirt off his palm. Wipes his hands.  9/15/09 2guns 88.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a free market, Manny, not a free world.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: I’1l take a look.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Hard. You’ll look hard.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Under every rock in Mexico. INT. GUEST SUITE, GRECO’S RANCH - NIGHT Bobby stews. Stig is in the bathroom examining the scente guest soaps.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Check this one. I think it’s Papaya. (off Bobby) Come on, one of us had to make a play.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You didn’t think to tell me about Corpus?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Invading a Navy base is not among your top drawer options.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You knew where the money was.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Like you've always told me everything? I could’ve let Papi Greco chop you into little pieces. But I didn’t. If that’s not enough of a good faith gesture I don’t know what is. Bobby scoffs. The doors suddenly SLAM open. Papi’s boys storm in...  9/15/09 2guns 89.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig jounce along in the bed of a rusty pickup, hoods over their heads. The pickup stops. Bobby and Stig are hoisted out, their hoods removed. They are in the middle of a BARREN MEXICAN NOWHERE. Hands march Bobby and Stig over to a panel truck. Inside 20 Mexicans clutch bundles and backpacks.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: The truck will take you near the border. From there you go on foot with the coyotes.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: If it’s all the same, we’d rather drive.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: With everybody looking for you, you'd get pulled out of line at the border in two seconds. No, you go over like you force my people. Papi’s men hoist Bobby and Stig up into the truck. PAPI. GRECO (CONT’D) I’m trusting you as men to fulfill your side of the bargain.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Scout’s honor. Papi WHISTLES. The side door of a van whips open. Inside Ferret-Nose Julio shines a light on the face of a cuffed gagged woman. If'’S DEB. Her eyes scream to Bobby as -- -- the truck’s roll door slams down. INT. CARGO BAY, PANEL TRUCK —- CONTINUOUS Bobby tries to wrench the door back up but it won't budge O.S. we hear the CLICK-CLACK of the door being padlocked the RUMBLE of the engine as the truck sloshes off on its

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Help me, goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to do.  9/15/09 2guns 90.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He’s got Deb.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I saw. Stig finds a comfortable spot among the other travellers.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Papi’s not gonna hurt her. She’s his insurance we come back with the money and not a squadron of helicopter gunships.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: When they drop us at the border, we'll double back.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: If we double back, he’ll put a bullet in her just for spite. Bobby knows Stig’s right. He kicks the wall of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We go ahead with the plan, get the money from the Admiral, then at least we have some leverage.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: A plan? You mean there’s an actual plan in your head for invading a high security naval base?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. Stig tilts his head back, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck bounces and sways. In the half light, Bobby considers the other passengers. A few know each other, bu for the most part they keep to themselves. Bobby sees the fear, their hope, their leap of faith determination. Beside Bobby, Stig starts to snore. Bobby pokes him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're snoring.  9/15/09 2guns 91.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Leave it to you to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I was tired. Stig pulls himself upright. Looks at Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You in love with her?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Deb? I don’t know. Haven't really been in a position to answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: ‘Cuz you kinda act like you’re in love with her. Bobby chews on that for a beat. STIG (CONT’D) You really wanna know why I can sleep? Because I know what I’m fighting for. You, you don’t even know how you got here.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m here because you set me up.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: The Admiral taught me duty, honor, loyalty to the chain of command. He may be a two-faced S.0O.B. but the values weren’t wrong. I went into that bank because I believed we had a debt to the men we'd left behind. And when we get to Corpus I’m going to kill the Admiral because he violated the trust that comes with oak leaves on your cap.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You’re an idiot.  9/15/09 2guns 92.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Of course I’m an idiot. To believe in anything you have to forget that for 50,000 years human beings have been chopping each other’s heads off and shoving each other into ovens. We’re not nice creatures. But at least I sleep at night. Stig tilts his head back, shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You wanna know why I went into that bank? It was the only way to get Papi Greco. And I was going to do whatever it took.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes is a dangerous thing, Bobby. The Admiral’s just doing whatever it takes. So are your buddys at the CIA. Me, I'd rather be an idiot. Stig shuts his eyes leaving Bobby to ponder this. Brakes SQUEAK as the truck jerks to a halt. The roll door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four COYOTES (bandanas over their faces, shotguns on thei arms) herd Bobby, Stig, and the others out of the truck a march them off into the desert night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig follow the others through the inky night. ground is ragged. Stumbles are frequent, but no one complains. No one helps anyone else up either. The coyotes prod one of the laggards on at gun point. Sti takes offense and interposes himself between the laggard the coyote. The dead-eyed coyote puts his muzzle to Stig’ chest. Bobby takes Stig by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Not our fight. Stig isn’t happy about it but he backs off and tromps onw  9/15/09 2guns 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coyotes lead the pack to a bluff overlooking the Rio Grande. The lead coyote points down to a narrow spit wher they should ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig follow the others down to the riverside. Wordlessly the immigrants remove their shoes and carry th up over their heads as they enter the water. Stig and Bobby wade in with the others. The water quickly rises to chest height. The swirling current threatens to knock them off their feet. One of the immigrant men slips, then surfaces with a spla of flailing limbs. He can’t swim. The other immigrants hustle out of the river and up the b afraid the drowning man’s noise will get them all caught. Bobby tosses his shoes at Stig and dives after the drowni man. The man grabs at Bobby’s face. Bobby bats away the panicked man’s arms and takes him around the neck.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Callate. Tranquilo. The man calms. Bobby hauls the man over to where he can stand. The man scampers up the bank and disappears. Bobby sloshes ashore. Stig tosses Bobby his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Not our fight?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: At least he stopped to say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Because that’s why you did it? For the thank you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: When this is over I’m still gonna shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Bobby.  9/15/09 2guns 94, Stig pats Bobby on the shoulder and heads up the bank. Bo finishes tying his shoes and follows. Trudging onward, they make their way toward the putrid so light glow smudged across the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig emerge into a vast mall parking lot filled with oblivious consumers lugging bags of extraneous, overpriced crap. After the coyotes and the desert and the river, the culture shock is a bit of a mind bender.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (re: the sea of cars) Got a favorite color?

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig drive East in a stolen blue minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby wakes. He is alone in the van. He climbs out. Across the way Bobby spots Stig at a picnic table in deep conversation with Mama Maybelle. Stig and Maybelle hug. Stig returns carrying a hefty duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I figure she should know how her son died.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Isn’t that a violation of government secrecy?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Arrest me. Stig hoists the duffle into the minivan, zips it open. Th bag is crammed with pistols, rifles, etc.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My rainy day stash. Stig digs out a pack of military I.D. cards. Selects two.  9/15/09 2guns 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavily fortified. Stig and Bobby roll up.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: My people. I do the talking.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m working on it. Stig holds the I.D. cards out to the SHORE PATROL GATE GU

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name, Seaman?

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: This is an improptu security inspection under D.O.D. order 27592, so give me your name before I decide I’m having a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: GATE. GUARD
dialogues.text: Seaman Weisberg, sir.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Write that down.

dialogues.speaker: GATE GUARD
dialogues.text: No disrespect, Commander, but all uncleared visitors have to be phoned into the security office.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What part of “impromptu” do you not register, Seaman? It means you don’t tell anyone you’re coming. Did you graduate high school, I know they make you graduate high school, so you had options. You didn’t have to burden my Navy with your stupidity. You chose to burden my Navy with your stupidity. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now wave us through and don’t even to think about FUBARing my inspection by alerting the world we're here to check the security status of this base. The SP motions to lift the gate and waves them though.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That was your brilliant plan?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it worked. Bobby checks his side mirror. In the reflection he sees t SP picking up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t get too healthy congratulating yourself. The guard’s in the shack on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No worries. It’1ll take at least 3 minutes to scramble the Shore Patrol so we’ve got that for a head start.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You are just a big ball of sunshine. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. -— DAY A small but pleasant house on base. The Admiral takes the million out of his safe and splits it between three suitcases. Quince enters.

dialogues.speaker: QUINCE
dialogues.text: It’s time, Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Thank you, Chief. If you’ll finish splitting the money between the bags. We'll cache the first in Panama, the second in Dubai, the third in Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: QUINCE
dialogues.text: Flight plan’s all arranged.  9/15/09 2guns 97. The Admiral gives Quince a “well done” pat and crosses in the LIVING ROOM where Teemo, pale and feverish, is laid o on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I hate to see you like this, son. An officer takes on a mission, he has to constantly balance the desire to protect his men versus the need to complete the mission.

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: For two days, I’ve been forced to let you suffer. And you have been magnificent. Because you understand the mission is greater than any one of us. If I could show you my heart, it aches. The Admiral stands. Levels a pistol at Teemo.

dialogues.speaker: TEEMO
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I take no pleasure in this. BLAM. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. - DAY SCREECH - Tires smoke as the minivan jerks to a halt outs the Admiral’s quarters. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS, CORPUS CHRISTI N.A.S. - DAY Stig and Bobby burst in the back door, guns at the ready. alternating turns they move forward through the house. On the sofa they find Teemo’s dead body.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Bobby crosses into the study and rifles the Admiral’s des Stig lingers reverently over the body. In a drawer, Bobby finds a bill from the CAMINO REAL HOTE A connection sparks...  9/15/09 2guns 98.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you delivered the money to the Admiral in El Paso what hotel was he staying at?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: The Camino Real. The information hits Bobby like a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sonofa... Come on. I know where to intercept the Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (still considering Teemo) I only shot him in the leg.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well, somebody else must have shot him in the chest. Bobby looks at Stig. Stig looks at Bobby. A mutual realization hits.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAPHONE VOICE, (0.S. - FROM OUTSIDE)
dialogues.text: Come outside with your hands raised. We have the house surrounded. Bobby and Stig rush to the windows. Outside the house is surrounded by four dozen armed SPs and a dozen vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Terrific plan you had.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I didn’t figure we’d need an exit strategy. (re: Teemo) You think they’1l think we killed him?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, they’re gonna think we broke onto the base to give him an appendectomy.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: There you go with the defensive sarcasm. All right, look, these are innocent sailors. I don’t want any of them getting shot.  9/15/09 2guns 99.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And I’m sure their orders are to just put a few warning shots in the backs of our heads.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I mean it. I want your word.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Good. So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (thinks) Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Not the question.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Yes. I do.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Then go outside and surrender. Bobby blows past Stig.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What? Bobby? EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME SPs with itchy trigger fingers surround the house... INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby cranks the bathroom tub on full bore. Then heads fo THE KITCHEN - Bobby pulls the stove out from the wall. Knifes the gas line. Then grabs a trash bag and goes into THE ADMIRAL’S BEDROOM - Bobby swipes a clean uniform. Stu it in the trash bag.  9/15/09 2guns 100. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The front door cracks. Stig slides outside, hands raised. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby tosses a bar tray on the kitchen floor. Smashes the neck off a whiskey bottle. Dumps it over the tray... EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Stig eases away from the house...

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS SHORE PATROL
dialogues.text: .»..On your knees... Hands where I can see ‘em... Give me an excuse... Stig sinks to his knees... INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME Bobby ties off the trash bag, tosses it in the now full t Takes a deep breath and... Bobby fires at the metal bar tray... The tray sparks. The booze catches fire... Bobby dives for the tub as... The leaking gas ignites. A FIREBALL shoots through the house... Bobby dives underwater as above him flames fill bathroom... EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The gas explosion blows out every window in the house. St is knocked flat. Splintered wood and glass fly. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The fireball retreats from the bathroom. Bobby pops up ou of the water with a gasp.  9/15/09 2guns 101. INT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - 15 MINUTES LATER Firemen storm the house with hoses and axes. There are sm and flames throughout the house, but the bulk of the fire contained in the kitchen. Amid the chaos, Bobby, slips ou of the bathroom, dressed in the stolen uniform.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Push those flames back.

dialogues.speaker: FIREFIGHTER
dialogues.text: (reacting to the uniform) It’s not safe yet, sir. You really need to stay outside. EXT. ADMIRAL’S QUARTERS - SAME The SPs have Stig stuffed in a patrol car. In the B.G. we see Bobby exit the house and slip away amid the commotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby drives through the lonely desperate landscape. Foot the floor. Eyes locked straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stands at a pay phone. He considers the sharpie scr on his arm. In his hand is Earl’s card.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Give me the office of the D.D.O.... It’s about 81.53 million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AGITATED LIEUTENANT leans in tight over Stig.

dialogues.speaker: AGITATED LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Silence is not your friend. You murdered a decorated Navy SEAL. Stig stares straight ahead. AGITATED LIEUTENANT (CONT’D) You've betrayed everything the service stands for.  9/15/09 2guns 102. Stig remains stone. The frustrated Lieutenant whips a cof mug past Stig’s ear. The mug shatters.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: That’s a waste of a good mug, sir. The door cracks as the Lieutenant is called out of the ro Two beats later he returns.

dialogues.speaker: AGITATED LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Get out of here. You’re free to go. Stig suspects a trick. He rises. He walks out. No one tries to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stig steps outside. Waiting there are Earl, Thick, and Le

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Get in the car. (when Stig hesitates) It’s not multiple choice, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squat turbo prop. The Admiral rests his elbow on the ca filled suitcases. Along the cargo bay wall sit Quince, Mi and the other SEALs (Lucas, Kelvin, Sanger, and Gomez).

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Make the Navy proud, boys. As one the SEALs rise and sprint out the back of the plan REVEAL - The plane is flying at 10,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down down down the SEALs plunge. Until finally at an impossibly low altitude - POP - they deploy chutes. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - NIGHT Papi circles around Deb. Deb holds her expression blank.  9/15/09 2guns 103.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Your Bobby’s a determined fellow. I don’t care what his badge says, he was Bobby Beans. And robbing the Tres Cruces only proves it.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Maybe he just has his own view of the law.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You don’t have to defend him. Papi reaches into a safe, counts out $400,000. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) You sure you wouldn’t rather take a percentage of the money he and Stig bring back?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: I don’t work on contingency. Papi smirks. Hands her the money. Pours them each a drink

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: When you told me Bobby was DEA, did you know he’d rob the Tres Cruces?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Just lucky I guess? Papi smiles. Deb smiles back. Neither smile quite genuine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE OF PAPI’S GUARDS patrol. 0O.S. They hear an approac engine. WHOOSH - The unlit C-2A skims just over their hea and touches down. The guards snap alert. The lead guard chatters into his radio. Several more guards arrive and surround the plane. The plane taxis to a stop and lowers its tailgate. The guards finger their triggers. Inside the plane a SPOTLIGH snaps on. On cue --  9/15/09 2guns 104. Bullets ZIP-ZIP-ZIP into the guards from all directions. Those who aren’t killed outright spray haphazard volleys the darkness until - ZIP-ZIP - they too are cut down. The Admiral steps off the plane. Quince and the other SEA who parachuted from the plane rise up from their hidden f spots around the airfield.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Scorched Earth, Chief. Nothing lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar (the guy who had the head in the bag) marches up to of Papi’s TOUGHS. 0.S. Sporadic GUNFIRE rips.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY, (IN SPANISH)
dialogues.text: Grab some men, head for the airfield. The toughs scurry off. Emerging from the shadows Bobby sneaks up behind Oscar. Oscar spins. Bobby kicks him in t balls. Smacks him with the butt of his pistol. Oscar’s no shatters. He drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby slips down the stairs into the network of tunnels t run beneath the ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jittery vaqueros pan their rifles as predatory shadows su and dart towards them. Closer. Closer. The vaqueros start popping off bursts of fire. SEAL hands snatch the vaqueros from behind and slash their throats. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - NIGHT Papi peers out the window and the black night. 0.S. Rippl of intermittent gunfire draw closer. Papi glances over at Deb who is recounting the $400k.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t usually do business with women.  9/15/09 2guns 105.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: That’s short sighted and sexist of you.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: With a man, you know why he does what he does. With a woman, who knows? Crossing to a filigreed chest Papi pulls out a shotgun. PAPI GRECO (CONT’D) Who’s out there?

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: How would I know? According to you I’m just supposed to sit here and look cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping across the ranch, the SEALS FIREBOMB the drug processing barns. EXPLOSIONS rock the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby scurries along. Up ahead armed toughs herd a clutch cocaine workers along at gun point. Bobby dives into a si passage and lets them pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby slips up into the main house through a hidden door. INT. LIVING ROOM, GRECO’S RANCH - SAME Papi jabs the shotgun at Deb. Deb calmly stows the $400k her jacket. O.S. more EXPLOSIONS boom.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Tell me who they are? CIA? DEA? Appearing in the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: U.S. Navy. You got in bed with the wrong girl.  9/15/09 2guns 106. As Papi whirls to level the shotgun at Bobby, Deb pulls a from her belt and just like that everyone starts blasting Bullets rip the air. Furniture shreds. Papi is hit in the gut. Deb flees. Bobby chases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb sprints down a long corridor. Bobby fires two shots p her ear. Dead to rites, she freezes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You should’ve told me Harvey was an Admiral. This all would’ve been so much easier to figure out. (beat) You're the one person I trusted.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You never trusted me or anyone. And don’t say you meant to. You were always all about you. Bobby is stung. Because it’s the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You're right. I was a sonofabitch. Now let’s go. Bobby snatches away Deb’s .22 and drags her onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roughnecks guarding the house spray wild gunfire as t murderously efficient SEALs - ZIP-ZIP-ZIP - wipe them out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby hauls Deb toward the back door. A stray volley SHATTERS the windows. Bobby yanks Deb to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You’ve got no chance, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Shh. Wait for it. O.S. The faint WHUP-WHUP of a helicopter. Bobby grins.  9/15/09 2guns 107.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling outside) Hey, Harvey, you out there?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Mr. Bobby Trench. You are a resilient fly in the ointment.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I've got Deb in here, Harvey, and since you two are in love, I thought you might be willing to trade her for the money.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: No. No deals.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well, before your boys start blasting, you might want to take a look off to the East. On the horizon, two lights approach low and fast. Twin bl helicopters armed with mean-ass 20mm gun cannons. The lead helo swoops down and alights while the second he circles protectively. Earl and his boys climb out draggin Stig with them.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Hail, hail, the gang’s all here. Mexican standoff time. Literally. The SEALs have their guns on the CIA. The CIA have their guns on the SEALs. Both side have their guns on Bobby as ushers Deb outside. Cautiously, The Admiral, Bobby, and Earl approach each ot Bobby towing Deb, Earl towing Stig.

dialogues.speaker: EARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the deal here, Bob? You promised me 81 million dollars in return for getting this pudknocker out of stir.  9/15/09 2guns 108.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I thought the Admiral might trade Deb for the money, but it turns out he’s not the romantic type, so I guess you two are gonna have to duke it out.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Is that right? A beat. All sides on edge. Who will make the first move? Out of nowhere - BA-BLAM - a shotgun blast rips into Earl arm. It’s PAPI GRECO. Bleeding from the gut, the drug lor lurches out of the house, shotgun blazing. Bobby tosses Stig a pistol as all sides open fire. It’s a free-for-all of dust and lead. Bullets fly. Bodies sprawl Two SEALs drop (Sanger & Kelvin). Bobby and Stig dash for the cover of a nearby barn while SEALs retreat toward the livestock pens and the helo rain down fire from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chased by strafing helo fire, Bobby and Stig dive inside.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Not to crack on your strategy, but this was the best you could come up with?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You’d rather be back in the brig? Bobby kicks the straw off a trapdoor. Beneath it is a lad leading to the tunnels. Ignoring Bobby, Stig takes a rifl off the body of one of Papi’s men.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, the tunnels lead all the way to the edge of the ranch.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And then we get the hell out of here before the Navy or the CIA or both of them shoot the hell out of us.  9/15/09 2guns 109.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: No. I’m not letting the Admiral get away with the money.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Jesus-goddamn... I just saved your ass.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: So go. Get out of here. Go tell the world Deb set you up and clear your name. It’s not like we’re in this together. Bobby curses. He kicks wall. He stays.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Where you go, I go. (beat) You’re my people.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: (touched) For real?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Can we just do this? Stig tosses Bobby an extra clip. Flanking the door, they peek out for the circling helicopters --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hate Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I’m sure it hates you back. -- and race off in pursuit of the Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cradling his shattered arm, Earl crosses to Papi, who lay dying in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: Why’d you lie to me? We were just doing business.

dialogues.speaker: PAPI GRECO
dialogues.text: Mow... my... lawn.  9/15/09 2guns 110. Papi manages a blood choked gurgle/giggle. Earl raises hi pistol and shoots Papi dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig engage the SEALs in a running fire-fight through the narrow alleys between pens. The spooked cattle buck, they bellow, they crash through fencing and STAMPEDE. Amid the swirl of 2000 pound beasts, Bobby and Stig get separated. Stig is knocked to the dirt. Quince steps out and has the drop on Stig when... A bullet rips through Quince’s neck. Quince falls reveali Thick as the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Thanks. Without hesitation or remorse Thick pivots his gun on Sti ...-Before Thick can fire, Bobby dives into view and fire the CIA man forcing him to retreat back out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We having fun yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-2A pilot fires up his engines as the Admiral and th remaining SEALs descend on the airfield. From above the CIA helo strafes the cockpit killing the pilot. As the pilot falls forward, he jams the right engi throttle causing the plane to taxi in a circle and crash a metal shed. The propellers shred. Bits of tin spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid the flames of the drug processing barns, Bobby and S trade heavy fire with Thick and Lean. From above the helo strafes. Bullets swiss-cheese the tin roof. Bobby and Stig go sprawling. Bobby spots a huge BULLDOZER. He taps Stig.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 9/15/09 2guns 111. ABOVE THE BARN - the circling helo pilot spots a puff of diesel smoke as Bobby and Stig come CRASHING through the of the barn on the bulldozer. The helo swoops. Bobby raises the front bucket as a shiel The helo’s bullets PING. Stig pours fire up at the helo’s tail rotor. The rotor sparks, smokes. The helo goes into a flat spin and CRASHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs retrieve the cash-filled suitcases from the crippled plane and toss them in an SUV when -- -- Bobby and Stig come barreling over the rise on the bulldozer. Gomez and Lucas hose down the dozer, while the Admiral, Deb, and Mini pile in the SUV. Flooring the throttle Bobby runs right over the two SEALs not before Lucas rolls a GRENADE beneath the treads. Stig and Bobby leap from the bulldozer as - BOOM - the grenade explosion FLIPS THE BULLDOZER onto its side. Bobby and Stig haul themselves up. In the distance the SU speeds off in a cloud of dust. Bobby and Stig look at each other. Look at the ratty CESS parked along the runway.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Bobby and Stig take off in the Cessna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV rips across the vast desert nothing, trailing a 5 yard plume of dust. Above, Stig throttles up the Cessna and dives. Swooping d he thumps the Cessna’s landing gear on the roof of the SU Deb jerks the wheel and speeds off in a different directi Stig loops around and dives again. This time Mini and the Admiral pour fire out the windows at the plane. Bullets r the cabin. Stig is forced to pull up.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: We could pull back and track them.  9/15/09 2guns 112. Bobby taps blinking “LOW FUEL” light.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: We don’t have the gas.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: That settles it then.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yup. Stig banks the plane around and dives so that the plane i a direct head-on collision course with the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: They’re coming right at us.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: They’11 pull up. IN THE PLANE -— Stig drops the Cessna so that its wheels scrape the groun

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t want me to pull up?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Cool. Plane and SUV hurtle at each other. 50 yards... 25... 10. Deb jerks the wheel. The SUV fishtails. The Cessna T-bone the SUV. The SUV barrel rolls. The plane goes ass-over- teakettle. Then silence. The SUV lays on its side, tires still spinning. The plane sits inverted on its back. INSIDE THE PLANE - Bobby and Stig hang upsidedown. Bobby claws at his belt release. Drops with a groan-inducing th

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (groggy) Well, that was a hoot.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You all right?  9/15/09 2guns 113.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Busted rib, maybe. Stig pulls at his belts. Jammed. Bobby looks over at the overturned SUV. The fate of its passengers undetermined.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. I’m cool. Bobby shimmies out of the plane. Gun drawn, he side steps toward the SUV. The SUV’s engine hisses... The tires spin Bobby swings around the nose and levels his pistol throug the fractured windshield at... Mini’s dead body. A pistol jabs against the back of Bobby’s neck. It’s the Admiral, his face bloody, his right leg dragging awkwardl

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Drop the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Stig, I kinda need your help here. Stig, who has dragged himself free of the plane, sees the Admiral with a gun to Bobby’s neck and snap draws his own The Admiral pulls Bobby tight in front of him as a shield

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: Don't do it, sailor.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Do it. Shoot him. Stig considers the narrow angle he has on the Admiral.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s tight.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You won't miss.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I could miss. Rising up from a ditch, Deb levels her gun at Stig.  9/15/09 2guns 114.

dialogues.speaker: DEB STIG
dialogues.text: Drop the gun. Aw, crap.

dialogues.speaker: DEB BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’1l1 shoot you where you Take the shot. stand.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL STIG
dialogues.text: She said to lay down the She’s kinda got a gun pointed weapon. at me.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Fine. I got yours. You got mine.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: If you miss and I get shot...

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL
dialogues.text: I’m gonna count to three. One. BLAM-BLAM - Stig and Bobby both fire. Bobby hits Deb in t chest. Stig puts his through the Admiral’s eye. Bobby crosses to Deb who is rapidly bleeding out.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Say something nice.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You always had a beautiful neck. Deb dies. Nearby Stig stands over the Admiral’s body. Bobby joins h

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Think they’11 give him a full honor guard?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Of course they will. There’s no way they'll admit the truth.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Well, that sucks. The remaining CIA helo, its gun cannon locked on, glides of the dawn and alights. Earl and the boys climb out. Ear motions to retrieve the money from the overturned SUV.

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: You won't mind if we take back what was ours all along.  9/15/09 2guns 115.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Would it matter if we did?

dialogues.speaker: THICK
dialogues.text: (aside to Earl) You're just gonna let them go?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: We have the money. The people who conspired to steal it are dead. We've got no further business with these gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What about the warrants for our arrest?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: A misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Both our names are clear?

dialogues.speaker: EARL
dialogues.text: I trust you’ll find your own way home? With that Earl climbs back into the helicopter and flies

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: What now? Bobby cross to Deb's body. Takes the 400k out of her jack Tosses it to Stig.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: For Mama Maybelle.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: There is one more thing. Bobby gives Stig a look.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Aw, you're not serious?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Leg or arm?  9/15/09 2guns 116.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You're really gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re gonna have to walk out of here, so I’m thinking arm.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: You are a petty, vindictive sonofa-- Bobby shoots Stig in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: STIG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! Motherless-goat-sucking...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hurts, don’t it? INT. MAMA MABELLE’S DINER - DAY Mama opens a brown wrapped packet. Inside is the $400k an photo of her son in his dress uniform. On the back of the photo is a note: “A pitiful token in honor of your loss.” On Maybelle. Moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of cash crammed safe deposit boxes. How much cash? Say 81.53 million? Earl flips the boxes shut. Slide them into their wall slots. Locks the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Centerville, Iowa is a placid mid-western small town. Exiting the bank Earl gets in a car with Mr. Lean. ACROSS THE TOWN SQUARE - at a window table in the CENTERV DINER are Bobby and Stig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stig, his arm in a sling, scans the menu as Bobby watches Earl drive off.

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: I saw some nice looking blueberry pancakes go by.  9/15/09 2guns 117.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: When have I ever ordered pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: There’s always hope. The waitress, MARGIE, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: What can I get you, boys?

dialogues.speaker: STIG
dialogues.text: Well, Margie, I was looking over the menu here--

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (cutting to the point) How are your jelly donuts?

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: To tell the truth, our donuts are kinda lousy.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you how happy we are to hear that.
